docs.title: What Is This?
docs.text:
A simple collection of cards contained within the Heroes of Might and Magic 3: The Board Game, that also offers extra explanations for how some cards work or interact with others.

Every now and then I want to see what some cards do, either while theorycrafting about what to play, or even during play, when I want to check or reference something. This database is meant to provide an easy way to find any card contained within the game, including a visual reference and extra information where necessary or applicable.

docs.title: Future Plans?
docs.text:
• Adding extra explanations to all cards that may need some
  • Fixing incorrect information (all of the cards were put in by hand, there is a chance that some may contains typos or other inaccuracies)

docs.title: Disclaimer
docs.text: This project is a fan project, and is in no way official or affiliated with Archon Studio.

docs.title: Air Magic
docs.text:
Ability

+1 for spells from School of Air Magic.

While casting from the School of Air, you can discard this card, then gain +3 .

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
• The expert effect may be played either from hand, or from the field. This does, however, not add the two effects, and the ability is put into the discard pile after being played.
  • See Permanent Effect

docs.title: Archery
docs.text:
Ability

During this Combat round, your Ranged units gain +1 if the target is a non-adjacent unit.

Until the end of the next Combat round, your Ranged units gain +1 and +1 if the target is a non-adjacent unit.

docs.title: Notes
docs.text: • This ability is active during each ranged attack of the Combat round, which means that it applies to both attacks of Elves and Marksmen.

docs.title: Armorer
docs.text:
Ability

+1 Then draw 1 card.

+2 Then draw 1 card.

docs.title: Notes
docs.text: • Armorer may also be played outside of Combat, in order to draw a card. In such case, the defense bonus is unused and lost.

docs.title: Artillery
docs.text:
Ability

Deal 1 to an enemy unit with the lowest .

When using the Ballista card, resolve its effect against the same target 3 times.

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
• If multiple enemy units share the same (lowest) initiative, the player can choose which of those units should this ability deal damage to.
  • The expert effect can only be played when the Ballista activates, which can only happen at the beginning of each Combat round.
  • Without an active Ballista, only the basic effect of this ability can be resolved.
  • In combination with Astrologers proclaim week of the Ammo Cart the expert effect will deal 3 times 2 damage, so 6 damage in total.

docs.title: Ballistics
docs.text:
Ability

Play this card during a siege.Destroy 1 Wall or Gate.

Play this card during a siege.Destroy the Arrow Tower.

docs.title: Diplomacy
docs.text:
Ability

For every Dwelling you have, draw 1 corresponding Neutral Unit card. You can Recruit one of these units if you its Recruitment cost.

Skip Combat with Neutral Units on a field whose Field Difficulty is equal to your Hero's level. Visit the field. This Hero gains no Experience.

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
• If the player already has a dwelling, they draw cards from both, the and Neutral decks.
  • The recruitment costs for neutral units can be found on the card of the respective unit.
  • For recruitment that happens as a result of using this ability, the recruitment token shall not be flipped. This means this ability may be used even after the player has already recruited units during this round.
  • 1 When played with miniatures (e.g. such as when playing on the large battlefield), this ability cannot be used to recruit units from a faction controller by another player, nor to recruit neutral units that are already recruited by another player. Should a player draw such card, that may not be recruited, they shall draw a replacement card instead.

docs.title: See Also
docs.text:
• List of Abilities

  1. Exceptions for specific game modes. This explanation is not valid for all game modes. The specific variant for the game mode is mentioned in the text. ↩

docs.title: Eagle Eye
docs.text:
Ability

Draw cards from the Spell deck until you find a Basic Spell card. Take it into your hand or discard it. Reshuffle the rest of the cards back to the Spell deck.

Draw cards from the Spell deck until you find an Expert Spell card. Take it into your hand or discard it. Reshuffle the rest of the cards back to the Spell deck.

docs.title: First Aid
docs.text:
Ability

Remove 1 from one of your units.

When using the First Aid Tent card, resolve its effect against the same target 3 times.

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
• The expert effect can only be played when the First Aid Tent activates, which can only happen at the beginning of each Combat round.
  • Without an active First Aid Tent, only the basic effect of this ability can be resolved.

docs.title: Intelligence
docs.text:
Ability

During Combat, before any unit activates, play a Spell card. You can still only play a Spell card during a Combat round.

During Combat, before any unit activates, play a Spell card. This spell does not count toward your spell limit per Combat round.

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
• If both players are resolving cards with effects at the start of the Combat (e.g. playing Intelligence), the attacker (or the player with the initiative token) may resolve their card first.
  • This ability can only be played at the start of the Combat itself, not at the start of any Combat round.

docs.title: Leadership
docs.text:
Ability

Gain a token.

Draw 2 cards.Then, gain a token.

docs.title: Learning
docs.text:
Ability

Play when the Hero is about to level up. Advance their Experience Level by an additional half level.

Play when the Hero is about to level up. Advance their Experience Level by an additional level, then Remove this card.

docs.title: Logistics
docs.text:
Ability

At the end of your turn, move your Hero's model to an adjacent empty field.

Your Hero gains +1 Movement.

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
• Fields are considered empty if they can not provide an effect or no longer provide an effect. This means that fields with black cubes or the player's faction cubes count as empty.
  • The additional Movement point may also be granted to the secondary hero.
  • The additional Movement point is single use effect, it does not permanently increase the maximum movement points of a hero.

docs.title: Luck
docs.text:
Ability

You can reroll a Treasure die and a Resource die once during this turn.

You can reroll any die once during this turn.

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
• The expert effect allows to reroll every die that the player rolls during their entire turn. This includes every attack die during all of the fights during their turn.
  • This ability may be played during an enemy's turn, only in a fight, and only if the player hero is defending themselves. It can only be played during the activation of a friendly unit.

docs.title: Mysticism
docs.text:
Ability

Play this card immediately after casting a spell. Instead of discarding the Spell card, take it back into your hand.

Play this card immediately after casting a spell. Instead of discarding the Spell card and all other cards player together with it, take them back to your hand.

docs.title: Necromancy
docs.text:
Ability

Play after winning Combat other than Quick Combat. You can Reinforce a or unit of your choice for half the cost (rounded down).

Play after winning Combat other than Quick Combat. You can Reinforce any unit of your choice for half the cost (rounded down).

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
• Only the heroes belonging to the Necropolis Faction may play Necromancy.
  • Necromancy may only be used to reinforce units that belong to the Necropolis Faction.
  • The reinforcing of units via Necromancy can also take place when the player does not have the Citadel built in their town.
  • If a hero that does not belong to the Necropolis Faction should draw it from the Ability deck, they may put it into the discard pile and draw another card instead. They may also choose to keep the card, they may, however, not play it.

docs.text:
Ability

+1 Then draw 1 card.

+2 Then draw 1 card.

docs.title: Heroes With Starting Ability

  • Ivor
  • Jeremy
  • Tamika
  • Tarnum (Stronghold)
  • Yog

docs.title: Pathfinding
docs.text:
Ability

This turn, your Hero can move through fields with Neutral Units and Enemy Heroes, but if they end their movement in one of these fields, Combat begins.

Your Hero can move over the yellow border and blocked fields, but cannot end movement on them.

docs.title: Resistance
docs.text:
Ability

Play this card immediately after the enemy casts a spell. If the spell was cast with 1 or less, ignore the Spell card's effect.

Play this card immediately after the enemy casts a spell. Ignore the Spell card's effect.

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
• The player's primary hero must take part in the Combat. It is not possible to play Resistance if the enemy hero is in Combat with neutral units or another player.
  • Resistance can nullify any spells cast by the enemy, not just those that target friendly units.

docs.title: Scholar
docs.text:
Ability

Choose 1 card from your discard pile and add it to your hand.

Remove up to 2 Statistic cards from your hand or discard pile. Take up to 2 different Empowered Statistic cards and put them on top of your discard pile. Remove the Scholar.

docs.title: Scouting
docs.text:
Ability

Play this card before taking a Search action, then do Search(3) instead.

Play this card before taking a Search action, then do Search(5) instead.

docs.title: Sorcery
docs.text:
Ability

+1 Then draw 1 card.

+2 Then draw 1 card.

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
• Sorcery may also be played without playing a spell, in order to draw a card. In such case, the spell power bonus is unused and lost.
  • Sorcery may be played to first draw a card. A spell drawn in this way may then be played immediately after being drawn and receive the spell power bonus granted by Sorcery.

docs.title: Tactics
docs.text:
Ability

At the start of Combat, you can switch the position of any 2 of your units.

During Combat, you can switch the position of any 2 of your units.

Ability

While casting from the School of Water, you can discard this card, then gain +3 .

docs.title: Wisdom
docs.text:
Ability

The cost of buying spells in this Town is reduced by 2 . When buying spells from your Magic Guild, do Search(3) instead of Search(2).

The cost of buying spells in this Town is reduced by 2 . When buying spells from your Magic Guild, do Search(4) instead of Search(2).

docs.title: Ambassador's Sash
docs.text:
Major Artifact

For every Dwelling you have, draw 1 corresponding Neutral Unit card. You can Recruit one of these units.— OR — Reroll a die.

You pause to help a diplomat with a broken axle to fix his problem. In gratitude, he gives you a sash with magical properties which he says will, "help people see things your way."

docs.title: Angel Wings
docs.text:
Relic Artifact

Chosen Hero gain +1 and can move through any fields without resolving them. The last visited field must be resolved normally.— OR — Draw a card.

Not really wanting to know where the Angel, whose wings these belong to, is, you take the wings and quickly depart.

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
• After playing Angel Wings, the hero may move through borders and blocked fields. They may, however, not end their movement on a blocked field.
  • See Blocked Field

docs.title: Armor of Wonder
docs.text:
Minor Artifact

Draw 1 card and gain +1 .— OR — Draw 1 card and gain +1 .

A gang of Rogues is sifting through the possessions of some dead warriors. Scaring off the scavengers, you notice the Rogues had overlooked a dirty, but serviceable, breastplate.

docs.title: Arms of Legion
docs.text:
Major Artifact

Reduce the Recruitment or Reinforcement cost of a unit by 5 - to a minimum of 0.— OR — Gain 2 .

Searching a ruin, you are amazed to find a piece of the Statue of Legion. You carefully dust it off before placing it in your pack.

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
• This artifact only reduces the recruitment cost, it does not allow for an additional recruitment to take place. During a round in which the player already recruited units (their population marker is already turned over), the discount effect provides no benefit, as the player may no longer recruit.
  • The recruitment discount may be played in combination with cards that allow recruitment (e.g. Necromancy).
  • Should the player recruit outside of their turn, the effect of the Arms of Legion may not be used.

docs.title: Blackshard of the Dead Knight
docs.text:
Minor Artifact

+2 and discard 1 card. If the discarded card was a spell, draw 1 card.— OR — +1

The widow of a former Captain of the Guard admires your quest and gives you the enchanted Sword that her husband relied on during his tour of duty.

docs.title: Boots of Polarity
docs.text:
Relic Artifact

Play this card after an enemy casts a spell. Roll 2 Attack dice and choose one. On a "+1 ", ignore the effect.— OR — Remove 1 effect.

A Nomad trader seeks protection from a tribe of Goblins. For your assistance, he gives you a finely crafted pair of boots. Looking closely, you see ancient carvings engraved on the leather.

docs.title: Boots of Speed
docs.text:
Minor Artifact

Your hero gains +1 .— OR — For this Combat, your selected unit gains +1 .

Visiting a local wise man, you explain the intent of your journey. He reaches into a chest and withdraws a strange pair of boots which he hands to you.

docs.title: Breastplate of Brimstone
docs.text:
Major Artifact

Search(../2) .— OR — +1 , then discard up to 3 cards from your hand to gain +1 per card discarded.

You meet a blacksmith who is melting down old pieces of armor. When he learns of your quest, he gives you a breastplate that he claims refused to melt, and is therefore of no value to him.

docs.title: Breastplate of Petrified Wood
docs.text:
Minor Artifact

Draw 1 card.— OR — +1

A gang of Rogues is sifting through the possessions of some dead warriors. Scaring off the scavengers, you notice the Rogues had overlooked a strange breastplate.

docs.title: Buckler of the Gnoll King
docs.text:
Minor Artifact

+2 Until the end of the Combat, this unit suffers -1 (to a minimum of 0).— OR — +1

A stone statue of a warrior holds a silver shield. As you remove the shield, the statue crumbles into dust.

docs.title: Cape of Velocity
docs.text:
Major Artifact

Until the end of the Combat, this unit gains +2 .— OR — Gain 2 .

A brief stop at an improbable rural inn yields an exchange of money, tales, and accidentally, luggage. You find a magical cloak in your new backpack.

docs.title: Cards of Prophecy
docs.text:
Major Artifact

Reroll any die.— OR — Set a or on the side of your choice.

You meet a traveler who offers to let you draw a card form the strange deck. When you refuse, he draws one himself. He has a momentary look of surprise on his face, then vanishes with a pop, dropping the cards. You gather them, and leave.

docs.title: Celestial Necklace of Bliss
docs.text:
Relic Artifact

Discard X cards from hand to gain +X .— OR — Remove this card, then gain +3 .

After rescuing a Sorceress from a cursed tomb, she rewards your heroism with an exquisite jeweled necklace.

docs.title: Centaur's Axe
docs.text:
Minor Artifact

Triple the Attack die's outcome.— OR — +1

You see a heavy axe embedded deeply in the ground. After several unsuccessful attempts by your army to remove it, you tightly grip the handle of the axe and effortlessly pull it free.

docs.title: Notes
docs.text: • The result of the Attack die may be tripled for purposes other than attacking, e.g. for playing the Inferno spell. In that case, the artifact can also be played after the Attack die roll.

docs.title: Charm of Mana
docs.text:
Minor Artifact

Discard 2 cards, then draw 3 cards.— OR — Draw 2 cards, then discard 1 card.

You come upon a caravan of gypsies who are feasting and fortifying their bodies with mead. They call you forward and say, "If you prove that you can dance the Rama-Buta, we will reward you." You don't know it, but try anyway. They laugh hysterically, but admire your bravery, giving you a strange charm.

docs.title: Crest of Valor
docs.text:
Minor Artifact

Gain a token.— OR — Ignore effect from a field.

After freeing a princess of a neighboring kingdom from the evil clutches of despicable slavers, she awards you with a Crest of Valor.

docs.title: Crown of Dragontooth
docs.text:
Relic Artifact

Select 2 Spell cards from your discard pile and put them back in your hand.— OR — Remove 1 from hand, then Search(2) .

Your troops find a crown. They hand it to you, and you notice an inscription. It reads: "Brains best brawn, and magic beats might. Heed my words, and you'll win every fight."

You meet an old Armorer, who claims he owes you a favor. Taking him up on it, he pieces together some Dragon scales, forming a well-fashioned breastplate.

docs.text:
Minor Artifact

Discard 1 random card from the enemy's hand.— OR — +1

Ridding the countryside of the hideous Dragon who made a sport of eating noblemen's Knights, you are honored with the Dragon Wing Tabard.

docs.title: Endless Bag of Gold
docs.text:
Major Artifact

Gain 3 .— OR — Remove this card, then gain 6 .

A nobleman, separated from her traveling companions, asks for your help. After escorting her home, she rewards you with a bag filled with Gold.

docs.title: Endless Purse of Gold
docs.text:
Major Artifact

Gain 3 .— OR — Remove this card and discard 2 cards from your hand, then gain 8 .

In your travels, you find a leather purse filled with gold that once belonged to a great warrior king who had the ability to transform any inanimate object into gold.

docs.title: Endless Sack of Gold
docs.text:
Relic Artifact

Gain 5 .— OR — Remove this card, then gain 8 .

A little leprechaun dances gleefully around a magical sack. Seeing you approach, he stops in mid-stride. The little man screams and stamps his foot ferociously, vanishing into thin air. Remembering the old leprechaun saying, 'Finders Keepers', you grab the sack and leave.

docs.title: Equestrian's Gloves
docs.text:
Minor Artifact

For this Combat, your selected unit gains +1 .— OR — Your Hero gains +1 .

A brief stop at an improbable rural inn yields an exchange of money, tales, and accidentally, luggage. You find a magical pair of gloves in your new backpack.

docs.title: Everflowing Crystal Cloak
docs.text:
Major Artifact

Discard 3 cards to gain 2 .— OR — Gain 1 .

Taking shelter from a storm in a small cave, you notice a small patch of crystal in one corner. Curious, you discover that the patch is really a cloak, and when you break a piece off it mysteriously grows back. You decide to take the cloak with you.

docs.title: Everpouring Vial of Mercury
docs.text:
Major Artifact

Gain 1 .— OR — Remove this card, then gain 2 .

A brief stop at a hastily abandoned Wizard's tower, you discover a magical vial of mercury that, as always, has a little left in the bottom. Recognizing a treasure when you see one, you cap it and slip it into your pocket.

docs.title: Glyph of Gallantry
docs.text:
Minor Artifact

Gain a token.— OR — +1

Ridding the countryside of the hideous Minotaur who made a sport of eating noblemen's Knights, you are honored with the Glyph of Gallantry.

docs.title: Golden Bow
docs.text:
Major Artifact

During this Combat, your units ignore the combat penalty.— OR — A unit of your choice gains +2 .

A chance meeting with a famous Archer finds you in a game of knucklebones pitting his bow against your horse. You win.

docs.title: Greater Gnoll's Flail
docs.text:
Minor Artifact

+2 Until the end of the Combat, this unit suffers -1 (to a minimum of 0).— OR — +1

A clumsy Gnoll has killed himself with his own flail. Knowing your superior skill with this weapon, you confidently remove the spectacular flail from the fallen creature.

docs.title: Helm of Heavenly Enlightenment
docs.text:
Relic Artifact

Gain .— OR — Draw 2 cards.

You spy a gleaming object poking up out of the ground. You send a member of your party over to investigate. He comes back with a golden helmet in his hands. You realize that it must be the Helm of Heavenly Enlightenment, the only helm ever rumored to be made from solid gold.

docs.title: Helm of the Alabaster Unicorn
docs.text:
Minor Artifact

Return 1 of your choice from your discard pile to your hand.— OR — Cast a spell from the top of the deck discard pile and Remove this card.

A traveling tinker in need of supplies offers your a helm with a unicorn's horn on its top in exchange for food and water. You accept, and later find out that the helm is magical.

docs.title: Hourglass of the Evil Hour
docs.text:
Minor Artifact

If the enemy has , they gain .— OR — Roll the Attack die. On a "0" result, you gain .

A surprise turn in the landscape finds you in the midst of a grisly scene - vultures picking at the aftermath of a terrible battle. Your cursory search of the remains turns up an enchanted hourglass.

docs.title: Inexhaustible Cart of Lumber
docs.text:
Minor Artifact

Gain 2 .— OR — Remove this card, then gain 4 .

Pausing to rest and light a cook fire, you pull wood out of a nearby lumber cart. As you keep pulling wood from the cart, you notice its cargo does not shrink. You realize to your delight that the cart is enchanted, so you take it along.

docs.title: Inexhaustible Cart of Ore
docs.text:
Minor Artifact

At the beginning of each Resources round, gain 1 .— OR — Remove this card, then gain 3 .

You've found a Goblin weapon smithy making weapons for use against humans. With a tremendous yell you and your army descend upon their camp and drive them away. A search finds a magic card that never runs out of ore.

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
• The second effect may be played either from hand, or from the field. This does, however, not add the two effects, and the artifact is put into the discard pile after being played.
  • See Permanent Effect

docs.title: Mystic Orb of Mana
docs.text:
Major Artifact

Search(../4) your discard pile.— OR — Only if your discard pile is empty. Draw 2 cards.

You come upon a caravan of gypsies who are feasting and fortifying their bodies with mead. They call you forward and say, "If you prove that you can dance the Rama-Buta, we will reward you." You don't know it, but try anyway. They laugh hysterically, but admire your bravery, giving you a strange orb.

docs.title: Necklace of Dragonteeth
docs.text:
Major Artifact

+2 .— OR — During this Combat, you can cast 2 per Combat round.

🚧

docs.title: See Also
docs.text:
• Crown of Dragontooth
  • Dragon Scale Armor
  • Dragon Scale Shield
  • Dragon Wing Tabard

  • Red Dragon Flame Tongue

  • List of Artifacts

docs.title: Ogre's Club of Havoc
docs.text:
Major Artifact

Discard 1 card to gain +2 .— OR — +1

At a roadside tavern, a drunken Ogre challenges you to a fight. Not wanting to hurt the creature, you subdue him, instead. You take his massive club from him to prevent him from getting into any more trouble.

docs.title: Orb of Inhibition
docs.text:
Relic Artifact

During this Combat, all and Specialty cards deal 0 . Remove this card instead of discarding it.— OR — During this Combat round, units cannot use their special abilities.

You help a Peasant catch a mare. As gratitude, he hands you a sphere. When you grasp it, you feel the magical energy drain from your limbs...

docs.title: Orb of Vulnerability
docs.text:
Relic Artifact

During this Combat, negate all units' special abilities related to .— OR — +2

You meet an old Wizard fiend of yours traveling in the opposite direction. He presents you with a gift: An orb that allows nearby magic resistant creatures to be harmed by magic.

docs.title: Pendant of Negativity
docs.text:
Major Artifact

Ignore the effect of a spell from the School of Air Magic— OR — Ignore the effect of a spell from the School of Air Magic

🚧

docs.title: Pendant of Second Sight
docs.text:
Major Artifact

Selected unit cannot gain during this Combat.— OR — Remove 1 token.

You come upon a very old woman dying alone. You tend to her final needs and promise a proper burial. Grateful, she gives you a magic pendant emblazoned with a stylized eye. It lets you see with your eyes closed.

docs.title: Recanter's Cloak
docs.text:
Major Artifact

During this Combat, no Hero can use spells with Power "0".— OR — During this Combat, no Hero can use Spells. Remove this card after Combat.

You discover a young woman fleeing from a hungry bear. You slay the beast in the nick of time, and the grateful Sorceress weaves a magic cloak from the bear's hide.

docs.title: Red Dragon Flame Tongue
docs.text:
Minor Artifact

+1 — OR — +1

As you are walking along a narrow path, a nearby bush suddenly bursts into flames. Before your very eyes, the flames become the image of a beautiful woman. She holds out a magnificent sword to you.

docs.text:

  • Dragon Scale Shield

  • Necklace of Dragonteeth

docs.title: Rib Cage
docs.text:
Minor Artifact

Select 1 Spell card from you discard pile and put it back into your hand. Then, shuffle your discard pile back into your deck of Might and Magic.— OR — +1

You trip over, what was, the rib cage of a large creature. Upon further examination, you discover the rib cage to be a piece of armor.

docs.title: See Also
docs.text:

  • Shield of the Yawning Dead

  • Skull Helmet

docs.title: Ring of the Wayfarer
docs.text:
Minor Artifact

For this Combat, your selected unit gains +1 .— OR — At start of Combat with Neutral Units put token on any unit except .

Visiting a local wise man, you explain the intent of your journey. He reaches into a sack and withdraws a strange ring which he hands to you.

docs.title: Sandals of the Saint
docs.text:
Relic Artifact

Discard X cards from hand to gain +X .— OR — Remove this card, then gain +3 .

🚧

docs.title: Scales of the Greater Basilisk
docs.text:
Minor Artifact

+3 — OR — +1 , then draw a card.

You meet an old Armorer, who claims he owes you a favor. Taking him up on it, he pieces together some Basilisk scales, forming a well-fashioned breastplate.

docs.title: Sentinel's Shield
docs.text:
Relic Artifact

Discard 1 card to gain +3 .— OR — +2

You find a large box that seems to be made from some unknown material. When you touch it, the box opens with a load hiss, revealing a gleaming shield within.

docs.title: Shackles of War
docs.text:
Major Artifact

If played at the start of Combat, the Enemy Hero can neither Retreat nor Surrender.— OR — Draw 2 cards, choose 1 card and discard the other.

Walking through the ruins of an ancient walled city, you find the instrument of the city's destruction, the elaborately crafted Shackles of War.

docs.title: Shield of the Damned
docs.text:
Major Artifact

Target unit gains +3 and suffers 1 . It cannot be used on an enemy unit.— OR — Target unit gains +5 and suffers 2 . It cannot be used on an enemy unit.

A Sprite is carrying a Shield as big as it is. Yuu ask, "Need help?" The Sprite glares at you and answers, "You think this is funny? Fine. You can carry it. I much prefer flying anyway."

docs.title: Shield of the Dwarven Lords
docs.text:
Minor Artifact

Use this after the Attack die roll. Ignore the Attack die and any additional effects it triggered.— OR — +1

While searching through the rubble of a collapsed mine, you free a group of trapped Dwarves. Grateful, the leader ives you a finely crafted shield.

docs.title: Shield of the Yawning Dead
docs.text:
Minor Artifact

Discard 1 card to gain +2 .— OR — +1

Your units discover an eerie shrine dedicated to the Undead. You bless the shrine, causing the stone shield emblem, above the altar, to crack. Beneath it, is a real shield, which you decide to remove from this unholy place.

docs.text:

  • Rib Cage

docs.title: See Also
docs.text:

docs.title: Speculum
docs.text:
Minor Artifact

Discover any Map tile adjacent to the Map tile your Hero is currently on..— OR — Remove this card, then draw 1 card.

A merchant from far away lands, trades you a new invention of his people for traveling supplies. It makes distant objects appear closer, and he calls it, a Speculum.

docs.title: Spellbinder's Hat
docs.text:
Relic Artifact

Remove 1 card from your hand, then Search(2) the card's deck.— OR — Remove this card and another one from your hand or discard pile.

You see a Wizard fleeing from a Dragon. He opens a portal and rides through, getting his bat knocked off by the edge of the gate. The Dragon follows, and the gate closes, You pick the hat up.

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
• With the first effect, only abilities, artifacts, and spells can be exchanged, as only those have a corresponding deck to draw from. Statistics and specialties can not be removed.
  • 1 With the second effect, any card may be removed together with the Spellbinder's Hat.

docs.title: See Also
docs.text:
• List of Artifacts

  1. Not officially confirmed by game designers, and is therefore considered a Community rule. ↩

docs.title: Spirit of Oppression
docs.text:
Minor Artifact

During this Combat, neither player can use the token or reroll Attack dice.— OR — +1

Walking through the ruins of an ancient walled city, you find the instrument of the city's destruction, the Spirit of Oppression.

docs.title: Surcoat of Counterpoise
docs.text:
Major Artifact

Play this card immediately after an enemy casts a . If it was cast with 1 or less, ignore the effect.— OR — Remove this card, then Search(1) .

The Necromancer blasts the Paladin with a fire bolt, bringing him to his knees. You slay the evil one before the final blow. The grateful Paladin gives you the cloak that saved him.

docs.title: Sword of Hellfire
docs.text:
Major Artifact

+3 . This unit suffers 1 . This effect cannot be used on an enemy unit.— OR — +4 . This unit suffers 2 . This effect cannot be used on an enemy unit.

During a sudden storm, a bolt of lightning strikes a tree, splitting it. Inside the tree you find a mysterious sword.

docs.title: Sword of Judgement
docs.text:
Relic Artifact

Discard X cards from hand to gain +X .— OR — Discard X cards from hand to gain +X .

A Paladin has been mortally wounded by a group of Zombies. He asks you to take his sword and finish what he started. As you pick it up, everything becomes a blur. The Zombies lie dead.

docs.title: Targ of the Rampaging Ogre
docs.text:
Major Artifact

Discard 2 cards to gain +2 . Then, instead of discarding, put this card back into your hand.— OR — +1

You come upon a bridge spanning a dry gully. As you begin to cross, a gigantic, maddened Ogre appears from the other side and charges toward you, forcing you to slay it. You decide to take its shield, as a trophy.

docs.title: Titan's Cuirass
docs.text:
Relic Artifact

Discard 1 card to gain +4 .— OR — +2 .

A Titan stops you and says, "Pay me 5,000 Gold, or I shall slay you where you stand." You refuse. The Titan grabs the sword hanging from his belt, but you duck between his legs. He is so surprised by this maneuver that he trips, falling on his sword and killing himself, instantly. You relieve him of his belongings.

docs.title: Titan's Gladius
docs.text:
Relic Artifact

Discard 1 card to gain +3 .— OR — +2

A Titan stops you and says, "Pay me 5,000 Gold, or I shall slay you where you stand." You refuse. The Titan grabs the sword hanging from his belt, but you duck between his legs. He is so surprised by this maneuver that he trips, falling on his sword and killing himself, instantly.

docs.title: Torso of Legion
docs.text:
Minor Artifact

Reduce the cost of Recruitment or reduce the cost of Reinforcing a unit by 6 (to a minimum of 0).— OR — Gain 1 or 2 .

Searching a ruin, you are amazed to find a piece of the Statue of Legion. You carefully dust it off before placing it in your pack.

docs.title: Tunic of the Cyclops King
docs.text:
Major Artifact

Draw 1 card and gain +1 .— OR — +2

You catch a Cyclops skinny dipping, and as a prank you make off with his clothes. Later, you realize the tunic is magical.

docs.title: Vial of Lifeblood
docs.text:
Major Artifact

Remove up to 3 from one of your units.— OR — For this Combat, your selected unit gains +1 .

You find a mystical shrine hidden among the trees. Floating above the altar is a vial said to contain the Blood of Life. You very carefully remove it, taking care not to disturb anything else.

docs.title: Ammo Cart
docs.text:
Astrologers Proclaim

Until the next Astrologers round, each Ballista deals +1 , each First Aid Tent heals +1 ‍, and each Ammo Cart allows re-rolling 1 Attack die for all ranged units.

Ammo cart - the best machine!Yo!Only I have the power of infinity!Why is there no hero who specializes in me?Because I should be a hero myself! Weehee!

docs.title: Notes
docs.text: • Should the expert effect of Artillery be used during this week, it will deal 3 times 2 damage, so 6 damage in total.

docs.title: See Also
docs.text:
• List of Astrologers Proclaim Cards
  • List of War Machines

docs.title: Annoying Lizard
docs.text:
Astrologers Proclaim

Each player must shuffle all Artifact and Spell cards from their hand back into their deck and draw the same number of cards from the top of their deck of Might and Magic.

Hey, Hero! Hero! Hey, Hero! Hero! Hey!

docs.title: See Also
docs.text:
• List of Artifacts
  • List of Astrologers Proclaim Cards
  • List of Spells

docs.title: Battalion's Stallion
docs.text:
Astrologers Proclaim

Until the next Astrologer's round:Each Hero gains +1 Movement.

"Yo, Adrienne, I did it!"

docs.title: Big Cleanup
docs.text:
Astrologers Proclaim

Each player must immediately discard all cards from their hand and draw the same number of cards.

- It's time for spring cleaning!- It's winter. We're in Eeofol... Duh...

docs.title: Blue Sky
docs.text:
Astrologers Proclaim

Until the next Astrologers' round, all from the Air Magic and Water Magic Schools are cast at a +1 .

Hey Elemental FacesWelcome to the Enroth RacesA celebration, Blue Sky's up there waitingAnd now is the day we've waited for

docs.title: See Also
docs.text:
• List of Astrologers Proclaim Cards
  • List of Spells

docs.title: Charlie and his Circus
docs.text:
Astrologers Proclaim

At the beginning of this round and the next one, each player can draw up to 3 cards from any Neutral Units deck(s) and Recruit one of them. The Players must still the recruitment cost and have the corresponding Dwelling in their Town(s). Shuffle the remaining cards back into their respective deck(s) afterwards.

Hi, Hero! Don't you want a balloon? I, Hero, am Charlie, the Dancing Clown. There are orcs, trolls, and all sorts of surprises down here. And balloons, too, all colors!

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
• units may not be recruited via this card.
  • 1 When played with miniatures (e.g. such as when playing on the large battlefield), this ability cannot be used to recruit units from a faction controller by another player, nor to recruit neutral units that are already recruited by another player. Should a player draw such card, that may not be recruited, they shall draw a replacement card instead.

docs.title: See Also
docs.text:
• List of Astrologers Proclaim Cards
  • List of Towns
  • List of Units

  1. Exceptions for specific game modes. This explanation is not valid for all game modes. The specific variant for the game mode is mentioned in the text. ↩

docs.title: Crazy Wizard
docs.text:
Astrologers Proclaim

Until the next Astrologers' round:The first Spell card player by each player is returned to the player's hand, instead of being discarded.

"I'm a flying pixie! Fly! Fly""Excuse me, Mr. Wizard, can you help us? We need to go to AvLee...""Sorry, kiddo, I don't do such stuff anymore. How about a hug? That's the best kind of magic there is!"

docs.title: See Also
docs.text:
• List of Astrologers Proclaim Cards
  • List of Spells

docs.title: Dancing Imp
docs.text:
Astrologers Proclaim

Each player can Remove a Statistic card from their discard pile or hand to gain 1 Empowered Statistic card of the same type.

Welcome to the hell hole, it gets worse here every day.Learn to live like a flame beast in the pit where we play.

docs.title: See Also
docs.text:
• List of Astrologers Proclaim Cards
  • List of Statistics

docs.title: Dead Silence
docs.text:
Astrologers Proclaim

Nothing changes.

Hello silence, my old friend.I've come to chat with you again.

docs.title: Explorers
docs.text:
Astrologers Proclaim

During this round, players do not draw cards at the start of their turns. Instead, each player draws cards up their . Then, each of them may discard any number of cards. For every 3 cards discarded this way, they can Remove one Statistic card and replace it with an Empowered Statistic card of the same type.

"We are explorers. The ones to delve into the unknown regions of experience. Demons to some, angels to others."

docs.title: Notes
docs.text: • 1 The removed statistic needs to come from the player's hand. When taking the empowered statistic, player adds it to their hand.

docs.title: See Also
docs.text:
• List of Astrologers Proclaim Cards
  • List of Statistics

  1. Not officially confirmed by game designers, and is therefore considered a Community rule. ↩

docs.title: Fancy Pixie
docs.text:
Astrologers Proclaim

Each player immediately gains 1

I decided to take, into my own hands, fate.This was the first time for love, I made.We were young, I was the moment's owner.We went out on a date to Skeleton Transformer.Her heart is on my sleeve, we know each other, thoroughly.I've looked right through her, I know every bone of she.

docs.title: Fluffy Rabbit
docs.text:
Astrologers Proclaim

Each player immediately rolls 1 Treasure die and gains the rolled bonus.

Hurry, hurry, get your free treasures, every treasure's a vote for Fluffy Rabbit!

docs.title: Forty Thieves
docs.text:
Astrologers Proclaim

Until the next Astrologers round, whenever a player is about to draw an Event card, they draw 2 cards instead of 1, choose 1 to resolve, and put the other at the bottom of the Event deck.

As I walk through the lands of the shadow of deathI look back at my deeds and realize there's not much leftYou better watcha' what you're talkin', and where you're walkin'Or you and your army might be covered with Rust Dragon's spit.

docs.title: Notes
docs.text: • In a game without events this card is removed and another card is drawn instead.

docs.title: See Also
docs.text:
• List of Astrologers Proclaim Cards
  • List of Events

docs.title: Friendly Beaver
docs.text:
Astrologers Proclaim

If you draw this card on the first Astrologers' round, discard it and draw another card.Immediately remove all Black cubes from all locations on the map.

"When the Sword of Frost touches Armageddon's Blade, the time of Enroth will be no longer then.""Do you know that doesn't really rhyme?"

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
• Only the black cube are removed, the colored faction cubes remain on fields (e.g. mines).
  • A second grail token can not come into play with this card, even if the field with the grail would be made visitable again.

docs.title: Gold Dragon
docs.text:
Astrologers Proclaim

At the beginning of the next Resource round, all players gain 5 .

Gold, gold, gold, live it up to your love.Gold, gold, gold, live it up to your hope.Gold, gold, gold, live it up to your dream.Gold, gold, gold, live it up to your soul.

docs.title: Greedy Dragon
docs.text:
Astrologers Proclaim

At the beginning of the next Resource round, all players gain 1 less , down to a minimum of 0.

Never laugh at live dragons, Dracon, you fool!

docs.title: Grim Warlock
docs.text:
Astrologers Proclaim

Until the next Astrologers' round:The first Spell card played in each player's turn gets +1 .

Against the power of Eeofol, there can be no victory!

docs.title: See Also
docs.text:
• List of Astrologers Proclaim Cards
  • List of Spells

docs.title: Groovy Satyr
docs.text:
Astrologers Proclaim

Until the next Astrologers' round:Whenever you trigger Combat with any Neutral Units, you may choose a Neutral Unit card to discard and draw another card of the same tier instead.

"Are you familiar with any AvLee melodies?""Sorry, no.""Well, that's good because this probably won't sound anything like one."

docs.title: See Also
docs.text:
• List of Astrologers Proclaim Cards
  • List of Units

docs.title: Hero
docs.text:
Astrologers Proclaim

Each player can 4 to Remove a Statistic card from their hand and replace it with an Empowered Statistic card of the same type. Each player may do so twice, but both exchanges must be made on the same turn. Once a player makes the exchange, they place their faction cube on this card to mark the fact.

"You are, without a doubt, the worst Hero I've ever head of!""But you have heard of me."

docs.title: See Also
docs.text:
• List of Astrologers Proclaim Cards
  • List of Statistics

docs.title: Isra's Friends
docs.text:
Astrologers Proclaim

Each player can immediately Reinforce a unit on the "Few" side at half the cost.

I was all alone, once upon a time.With me, I only had a knife.But now, I have friends.Now, I have friends for live.

docs.title: See Also
docs.text:
• List of Astrologers Proclaim Cards
  • List of Units

docs.title: Magic Tortoise
docs.text:
Astrologers Proclaim

Until the next Astrologer's round:Each Hero suffers -1 Movement.

Men live and die, and the Tortoise Moves. Empires grow and crumble, and the Tortoise Moves. Gods come and go, and still the Tortoise Moves. The Tortoise Moves.

docs.title: See Also
docs.text:
• List of Astrologers Proclaim Cards
  • List of Heroes

docs.title: McGiver
docs.text:
Astrologers Proclaim

At the beginning of the next round, each player can take 1 War Machine of their choice from the War Machines deck at not cost.

Hi, this is McGiver. We all know how the War Machines work, so when you hear the vrrrum, go for it.

docs.title: Notes
docs.text: • The war machine will be chosen and taken in the resource round that follows the current astrologers proclaim round.

docs.title: See Also
docs.text:
• List of Astrologers Proclaim Cards
  • List of War Machines

docs.title: Merry Leprechaun
docs.text:
Astrologers Proclaim

At the beginning of the next Resource round, all players gain 1 .

"I wasn't aware that leprechaun gold vanishes." "How could it be else when you just have taken it from me...?"

docs.title: Plane Between Planes
docs.text:
Astrologers Proclaim

Each player can immediately Remove up to 2 cards from their hand or from their discard pile.

Hello? Is anybody right there?

docs.title: Profuse Growth
docs.text:
Astrologers Proclaim

Until the next Astrologers' round:Your hand limit is increased by 1.

A horn of plenty spills from your hands into the starved lives of hundreds...

docs.title: Scorched Ground
docs.text:
Astrologers Proclaim

Until the next Astrologers round, all from the Earth Magic and Fire Magic Schools are cast at a +1 .

And I miss you, like the scorched earth miss the rain.

docs.title: See Also
docs.text:
• List of Astrologers Proclaim Cards
  • List of Spells

docs.title: Society
docs.text:
Astrologers Proclaim

Each player gains .

Some Kreegan has told me: "Hell is other people."

docs.title: Swift Weasel
docs.text:
Astrologers Proclaim

Until the next Astrologer's round:Once per turn, each player can reroll a Treasure die or a Resource die.

You need cool rants for the victory dance.Baboons are never better than weasels.Your opponent reigns king in their mind.They dream to be great as the weasely kind.I am the Swift Weasel!

docs.title: Terrible Plague
docs.text:
Astrologers Proclaim

All players flip one of their units from the "Pack" to the "Few" side, if possible.

All populations are halved.Snap.

docs.title: See Also
docs.text:
• List of Astrologers Proclaim Cards
  • List of Units

docs.title: Unexpected Reinforcements
docs.text:
Astrologers Proclaim

Each player can immediately search the Neutral Units deck and Recruit 1 chosen unit associated with their faction for free. Each player still needs to have the corresponding dwelling built in their town.

"My Lord, my Lady! We're at your command!"

docs.title: Notes
docs.text: • units may not be recruited via this card.

docs.title: See Also
docs.text:
• List of Astrologers Proclaim Cards
  • List of Towns
  • List of Units

docs.title: White Raven
docs.text:
Astrologers Proclaim

Each player immediately rolls 1 Resource die and gains the rolled resources.

"Where do you go, fantastic dream bird?""Eeofol, Deyja, Place Between Planes... Still interested?"

docs.title: Wild Debauchery
docs.text:
Astrologers Proclaim

At the beginning of the next Resource round, all players gain 5 less .

Sit down, there's a party in the tavern today!We are thirsty again!La la la!We drink for a week of Wild DebaucheryFor seven days now!La la la!

docs.title: A Shady Auction
docs.text:
Event

Repeat 3 times: Reveal the top card from the Artifact deck. In secret, each player takes as much in their hand as they are willing to pay for it. Then reveal your bets at the same time. The one with the highest proposal discards the and claims the card. If there are no bets or there is a tie, discard the card.

In the depth of the night, you come across a crowdy camp encircling a stage. On it, a corpulent man with a twirly mustache is shouting vigorously, "...and the vase goes to the lovely bearded lady in the back row! Now gaze upon this marvelous item I shed tears and blood to get! Not mine of course... The starting price is..."

docs.title: Artifact Merchant
docs.text:
Event

Draw 5 artifacts. You can buy either any number of them or the face-up card from the Artifact discard pile. After finishing, give the rest of the cards to the player on the left. The exchange goes on until the last card is bought or the cards return to the one who drew them. Minor Artifacts cards cost 3 , Major 5 , Relic 7 .

On your journey, you wander into a blacksmith's workshop. They welcome you with a cheerful laugh and present their wares.

docs.title: Crypt
docs.text:
Event

Each player chooses one option: Gain Negative Morale. Then roll 2 . If any of them shows #, you gain nothing. Otherwise, resolve one result.— OR —Gain Positive Morale.— OR —Only for . Reinforce one of your or for half the cost.

You tentatively approach the burial crypt of ancient warriors. Disturbing the peace of the dead is a dirty and despicable act. Yet, something of worth may be buried among these ancient graves...

docs.title: Cursed Swamp
docs.text:
Event

Each player chooses one option: Gain Negative Morale. Then roll 2 and choose one result.— OR —Remove one or more from your hand; if you remove at least 2, Search (3) the Artifact deck.— OR —Discard your cheapest unit.— OR —Only for . Reinforce one of your or for free.

On your journey, you wander into a swamp. Only after some time do you notice the eerie atmosphere surrounding this place and the eyes lurking just beneath the water's surface. Eyes of the dead. Your army trembles in panic while you gather your thoughts. Will you force them to go on or, maybe, shield them with your magic?

docs.title: Den of Thieves
docs.text:
Event

Take the top 2 cards from a Neutral Unit deck of your choice. You may buy one of them. Then decide what to do with the remaining card(s) - you may place them at the bottom or top of the respective Neutral Unit deck.

Searching through the underbrush, you find the secret entrance to the Den of Thieves. In there, an old "acquaintance" grabs your arm and starts talking about all the "secrets" she has learned since you last meeting.

docs.title: Garden of Revelation
docs.text:
Event

Each player chooses one option: Draw 4 cards either from your discard pile or your deck. Then Remove any number of Spell or Ability cards from your hand. For every two cards removed this way, you can perform Search(2) the Spell deck or the Ability deck. After that, discard all cards from hand and draw up to your .— OR —Leave and gain nothing.

Beside the road you see a beautiful garden filled with flowers in full bloom. A monk sitting in the middle invites you to meditate with him.

docs.title: See Also
docs.text:
• List of Abilities
  • List of Events
  • List of Spells

docs.title: Library of Enlightenment
docs.text:
Event

For every player in the game, draw the top two Spell cards and put them face-up within all players' reach. Each player can buy once of these for 6 or 2 .

In the town you are currently visiting, there is a famous library said to possess a vast collection of arcane tomes. Are you willing to seek their knowledge?

docs.title: Mage Laboratory
docs.text:
Event

For every player in the game, draw two Spell cards and place them face-up within all players' reach. Each player can buy one of these for 4 or 1 . If a player buys a card, they immediately shuffle their deck and discard pile along with the newly bought card.

In the distance, you spot green smoke coming from a lonely tower in the middle of nowhere. When you approach, you are met by a lone mage in a tattered robe sitting by the entrance. Without looking at you, he says: "Tell me what your hea..." The mage hiccups. "...heart desires. And ale... isle... I'll prepare appperfect spell for that..." he gulps from a vial. "...Sooner'rr'laterr."

docs.title: Magical Forest
docs.text:
Event

Choose 1 Spell, Artifact, or Ability card from your hand and put it face-down on the table.— OR —Draw and view 1 card from the Spell, Artifact, or Ability deck and put it face-down on the table.When all players have added a card to the pool, shuffle it. Each player can now either take a card from the pool or gain 4 .

The sound of music lures you into a magical forest where you see a young person running through the wood. The elusive silhouette disappears whenever you get closer. Finally, you catch up and grab their arm... only to wake up and discover you were unconscious for several hours. Dejected, you rise from the moss with a strange feeling that something has changed.

docs.title: See Also
docs.text:
• List of Abilities
  • List of Artifacts
  • List of Events
  • List of Spells

docs.title: Market of Time
docs.text:
Event

Each player chooses one option: Discard as many cards as you want, then draw new cards up to your +2. Remove any number of Ability or Spell cards from your hand. For every two cards removed this way, you can perform Search (2) the Artifact deck.— OR —Leave and gain nothing.

In the middle of a small town, you stumble upon a bustling and noisy market. Lured by the cheerful atmosphere, you start walking around. Each item on the display seems weird......after hours of wandering, you find yourself in the middle of the road, not sure when you left the market. When you turn around, you see just an empty road... not even a town in sight. Was all of that just a dream?

docs.title: See Also
docs.text:
• List of Abilities
  • List of Artifacts
  • List of Events
  • List of Spells

docs.title: Marketplace
docs.text:
Event

Each player chooses one option: Roll 1 and resolve its effects.— OR —Trade resources using Trading Post rules.— OR —Propose an exchange of resources with other players - one type of resource for one type of resource. Each player can propose one deal.

While passing through a small town, you find a lively marketplace. Despite all the turmoil in the world, this place seems strangely cheerful and happy. Will you stop to see what they offer?

docs.title: Mercenary Camp
docs.text:
Event

Each player can draw up to 2 Neutral Unit from one of the chosen decks. Then they are spread on the table, and each player can Recruit one of them.

You've come from a camp of mercenaries practicing their combat tactics. They welcome you and your troops and invite you to train with them. Sounds too good to be true...

docs.title: Messenger with Supplies
docs.text:
Event

Each player draws 2 top cards from the Artifact deck and then chooses one option: Buy one of the cards. Minor Artifacts cards cost 3 , Major 5 , Relic 7 .— OR —Put them both on the Artifact discard pile to roll 2 and resolve one of them.

A lone rider on a battered horse catches up with your army.They dismount, pull out a small package, and stagger toward you.Gasping heavily, the messenger starts:"Your... delivery... arrived..." After that, they faint.You don't remember ordering anything...

docs.title: Mischievous Leprechaun
docs.text:
Event

Pool 2 and 2 , roll them, and put them within all players' reach. Starting from the player who drew this event, each player rolls 1 and 1 . If they can match any of the pool's rolls, they may take one matching die from the pool and resolve its effects.

You are making your way through the dense forest when you stumble upon a mischievous magical creature - a leprechaun sitting on a pile of treasures."Answer my question and I shall part with some of these worthless trumpery. Now... what do I have in my pocket?"

docs.title: Prison
docs.text:
Event

Draw 2 Neutral Unit cards from any deck (except for Azure). You can buy one of them or discard it to gain 3 . After that, pass the remaining card to the next player. That player also draws a Neutral Unit card from any deck (except for Azure) and repeats the rest of the process. The exchange goes on till every player has a chance to choose something.

In the town you have passed recently, you heard rumors of some people from your lands having been imprisoned by a local governor. In a dazzling display of daring, you break into the jail and free all imprisoned there. In return, some of them pledge loyalty to your cause.

docs.title: School of Magic and School of War
docs.text:
Event

Each player chooses one option: Discard as many cards as you want, then draw new cards up to your +2. Remove any number of Ability or Spell cards from your hand. For every two cards removed this way, you can perform Search (2) the Ability deck or the Spell deck.— OR —Leave and gain nothing.

On your journey you happen upon two majestic buildings from which two figures emerge - an acolyte whose mere presence fills the air with a tingle of magic and a battle-scarred instructor, grunting between sentences. The both shout at passers-by: "Come and learn the secrets of mystical arts!" "No! Fancy tricks are for the weak. I touch what real warriors need!"

docs.title: Shrine of the Magic Thought
docs.text:
Event

For every player in the game, draw two random Spell cards and place them face-up within all players' reach. Each player can either buy one of these for 6 or 2 or roll and resolve 1 . Place the remaining, not bought, cards in the Spell discard pile.

You come across a lavish shrine attended by a group of high priests. Their eyes are full of fear, and they beg you to chase away nearby monsters. In exchange for protection, they agree to teach you a sophisticated spell.

docs.title: Stables
docs.text:
Event

Each player chooses one option: Your Main hero gains +1 .— OR — 1 from any of your heroes to roll 1 .

While traveling to your next location, you see a small fork in the road. Out of curiosity, you check it out and find an old stable. The overjoyed host offers you an amazing bargain.

docs.title: The Villagers' Plea
docs.text:
Event

Each player chooses one option: Remove an Artifact or Spell card from your hand.— OR — 1 — OR — 5 — OR — 1 from any of your heroes.

In the distance, you see a small village covered in a cloud of smoke. Upon arrival, you are greeted only by charred ruins and the lamentations of families who lost all they had. Will you help them?

docs.text:

  • List of Heroes
  • List of Spells

docs.title: Withered Hermit
docs.text:
Event

Each player chooses one option: Name a resource that will not show on any of the dice, then roll 3 . If you are correct, resolve one of the dice. If you are wrong, choose one result and subtract it from you resources.— OR —Roll 1 . You may pay the indicated resources to Search(2) the Artifact deck.— OR —Leave and gain nothing.

You've found the humble dwelling of a withered hermit. The hermit tells you that he is willing to give his treasure to the first wise person he meets.

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
• A blocked field is fully enclosed by a thick border and heroes are not allowed to enter it in general.
  • 1 Should a hero be allowed to enter a blocked field due to an effect, they may only pass through. That means that they are required to immediately use another movement point during the same turn to move out of the blocked field. If they would not be able to leave the field, they are not allowed to enter it.
  • 1 Should a hero need to retreat back to a blocked field, they are allowed to do so, as long as they have a spare movement point that they can use to also move out of the blocked field during the same turn. If they have no movement points left, they retreat back to the field they were standing on before moving to the blocked field instead.
  • A hero is not allowed to end their turn on a blocked field.
  • 1 A field that is occupied by a player's hero may be used by the player's other hero to pass through. This means the hero needs to have another movement point available after moving to the field. Fields occupied by the player's heroes follow the same rules as blocked fields.

  1. Not officially confirmed by game designers, and is therefore considered a Community rule. ↩↩↩

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
• A paralyzed unit skips its next activation. Instead of activating, the token is removed from it.
  • The token is removed prematurely if the paralyzed unit receives damage. An attack that does not apply any damage does not count towards this.
  • If the paralyzed unit received damage from an attack, it will retaliate (if not done so prior during this Combat round).

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
• A card with a permanent effect is played from hand, just like any other card. The cards stays on the field after being played, its effect lasting continuously, and it does not go to the discard pile.
  • The player may decide to put an active permanent card into their discard pile. This stops the card effect immediately.
  • Each player can only have a single active permanent card at any time. Should they play a new one, the currently active one goes into their discard pile and the newly played card takes its place.

docs.title: Clash
docs.text:
A fully competitive mode for 2-3 players.

Name Players Description All For One 3 Three life-long friends become enemies, when each inherits a portion of the kingdom, following the King’s death. You must show your former friends how to rule... through conquest. Brave New World 2-3 A great upheaval shook the very foundations of the world, breaking apart continents and dividing territories in new breaking apart continents and dividing territories in new ways. After the earth stood still once more, the people crawled out from their hiding places and have begun rebuilding this Brave New World. Carpe Diem 2 A few years back, the Gods decided they no longer wanted any part in this world. Now there is total anarchy. Everybody blames everyone else for the gods abandoning them. While sitting in the throne room, you decided you are the only person fit to rule. Dwarven Gold 2-3 Dwarven gold madness swept the region when Invis Smythers (renowned Dwarven miner) struck it lucky when he found a gold vein worth 75,000 gold pieces. Local lords have started mounting expeditions. Manifest Destiny 3 The neighboring lands have become increasingly more crowded. Only one kingdom is fit to rule the others. It is time to show the other petty nobles it is your manifest destiny to rule this land. Monk’s Retreat 2 The monks who ruled this area of the world for years, have finally been pushed back to their islands. As one of the lords just freed by the monk’s retreat, you feel it is up to you to unite these lands under your rule. Search For The Grail 2-3 The Grail is said to have been lost somewhere in the area, and you have been charged with finding and retrieving it. But beware! The minions of your enemies are also seeking to lay their hands on it!

docs.title: Campaign
docs.text:
A single player mode of interconnected Scenarios against an enemy AI.

Name Scenarios Faction Description Long Live The Queen 1. Homecoming2. Guardian Angels3. Steadwick’s Liberation Castle Our landing has confirmed both our rumors and fears. With the death of my father, Erathia’s lands are being greedily divided by her neighbors. Dragon’s Blood 1. Savaging The Scavengers2. Blood Of The Dragon Father3. Blood Thirsty Dungeon Overlord Mutare, an ambitious Nighon Lady, wishes to take her rightful place among the ranks of powerful Nighon Lords. In Nighon, you don’t inherit your lands - you take them from those too weak to hold them. Only the strong are fit to rule, and the bones of the weak litter the tunnels of Nighon. Rise Of The Necromancer 1. Target2. Master3. Duke Alarice Necropolis Sandro must fight his way past his old master and several other lords who want the artifacts he carries. Once in Deyja he will make allies and soon rise to the top of the Deyja hierarchy. The Dragon Slayer 1. Crystal Dragons2. Rust Dragons3. Faerie Dragons4. Azure Dragons Tower The way of a Dragon Slayer is harm’s way. To prove himself one, Dracon has to rise to a handful of perilous challenges, and defeating a Crystal Dragon is but the first step. Once it is made, Dracon will have to seek out and battle the greatest wyrm to have ever lived, as only when the Azure Dragon perishes can Dracon truly call himself a Dragon Slayer. Playing With Fire 1. Farming Towns2. March Of The Undead3. Burning Of Tatalia Fortress After the Restoration of Erathia, the necromantic cult of Lord Haart was made illegal, and its members went underground. Cultists resurrected their leader and decided to move to Tatalia.At the same time, after receiving lessons from clerics in Steadwick - the Erathian capital, the witch Adrienne returns to her homeland - Tatalia. Her brethren treat her with distrust also because she specializes in fire magic, rare in Tatalia. She discovers a Death Knight is turning the local population into a harvesting ground for Undead. Restore the land and hunt down this evil. Utter extermination of the undead plague is your ultimate goal. Dead-Cold Revenge 1. Search For A Killer2. Final Peace3. Agents Of Vengeance Rampart TWhen two AvLee lords are found dead, Gem and Gelu set out on their vengeful quest to seek justice. Their fates, however, unexpectedly lead them to find much more than they had hoped for. Will they manage to foil the sinister plot brewing on AvLee borders, or has the gruesome discovery come too late to stop the Necromancers’ schemes?

docs.title: Alliance
docs.text:
A 2 versus 2 team-based mode. You will need an expansion pack with a town to play a 4-player game.

Name Description Arrogance Once, centuries ago, the world was at peace. Four cultures lived in harmony and freely associated with each other. Then you came into power and realized things would be better for you if you took over the entire world. Tale Of Two Lands The continents of East and West Varesburg have decided to wage war one last time. Securing the resources of your continent (with help from your ally) and then moving on to the other as quickly as possible is the best strategy for the battle of the Varesburgs. The Challenge The king has just revealed that it is only a matter of months before he passes away. For that reason he announced that whoever rises to the challenge of building the grail structure in the capital city of Osha within the next six months will be anointed as his successor. The gauntlet has been thrown, will you take it up?

docs.title: Cooperative
docs.text:
A Cooperative mode for 2-3 players where everyone shares the same goal.

Name Players Description Gelea’s Champions 2-3 You and your ally have been invaded by warlords from another world. The time has come to strike back. Gather your forces and make temporary alliances to pile up resources in order to save the realm! Unholy Quest 2-3 Deep below the surface lurk monsters, the likes of which no one has ever seen before. Word is that the monsters are preparing to rise from the depths and lay claim to the surface world. Go forth and slay their evil armies before they grow too large. You may be the world’s only hope!

• 1 It is uncertain what it meant by "effect" here.
  • 2 Cure can only be cast on a friendly unit.
  • 2 The removal of an effect is optional. A positive effect does not have to be removed and may therefore remain active.

  1. Open question that has not yet been answered. ↩

  2. Not officially confirmed by game designers, and is therefore considered a Community rule. ↩↩

docs.title: Curse
docs.text:
Basic Fire Spell

The selected unit suffers (to a minimum of 0): 0 ➣ -1 1 ➣ -2 2 ➣ -3 — OR — +1

docs.title: Dimension Door
docs.text:
Expert Air Spell

Move a Hero up to * field(s). Ignore any obstacles and fields in-between and resolve the last one normally. 0 ➣ *1 2 ➣ *2 4 ➣ *3— OR — +1

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
• Dimension Door can only move the caster's Hero, not a Hero controlled by any other player.
  • May be used to jump over blocked fields.

docs.title: Dispel
docs.text:
Basic Water Spell

Remove all effects from a space or a * unit and the space it occupies. 0 ➣ * 1 ➣ * or 2 ➣ * or or — OR — +1

docs.title: Notes
docs.text: • Global effects that are not bound to a specific unit (e.g. Archery) may not be removed.

docs.title: Disrupting Ray
docs.text:
Basic Air Spell

Until the end of the Combat, the selected * unit cannot use their special ability: 0 ➣ * 1 ➣ * or 2 ➣ * or or — OR — +1

docs.title: Earthquake
docs.text:
Basic Earth Spell

During a Town siege: 0 ➣ Remove 1 Gate or Wall obstacle of your choice. 1 ➣ Remove 2 Gate or Wall obstacles of your choice. 2 ➣ Every unit adjacent to a Wall or Gate obstacle suffers 1 . Remove all Gate or Wall obstacles.— OR — +1

docs.title: Fire Shield
docs.text:
Expert Fire Spell

When the targeted unit is attacked by an adjacent unit during this Combat round, the attacking unit takes: 0 ➣ 1 2 ➣ 2 4 ➣ 3 — OR — +1

docs.title: Notes
docs.text: • The attacking unit is damaged by the Fire Shield even if it defeats the unit which has Fire Shield.

docs.title: Fire Wall
docs.text:
Basic Fire Spell

For this Combat, place this card in an empty space on the Combat board. Deal * to any unit stopping here and to any or unit passing through. 0 ➣ *1 2 ➣ *2 4 ➣ *3 — OR — +1

docs.title: Notes
docs.text: • 1 On the large battlefield, a Fire Wall token is placed onto the battlefield instead of the card.

docs.title: See Also
docs.text:
• School of Fire Magic
  • List of Spells

  1. Exceptions for specific game modes. This explanation is not valid for all game modes. The specific variant for the game mode is mentioned in the text. ↩

docs.title: Fireball
docs.text:
Expert Fire Spell

Select 2 adjacent places. Deal * to units in these spaces. 0 ➣ 1 2 ➣ 2 4 ➣ 3 — OR — +1

docs.title: Notes
docs.text: • The from Fireball also applies to friendly units.

docs.title: Fly
docs.text:
Expert Air Spell

During this turn, your Hero can move through the blocked fields (but cannot end their movement there) and: 0 ➣ No additional effect 2 ➣ +1 4 ➣ +2 — OR — +1

docs.title: Forgetfulness
docs.text:
Basic Water Spell

During its next activation, a * unit if your choice cannot . 0 ➣ * 1 ➣ * or 2 ➣ * or or — OR — +1

docs.title: Fortune
docs.text:
Basic Air Spell

Reroll one Treasure, Resource, or Attack die *. Resolve the result of your choice 0 ➣ *once 1 ➣ *twice 2 ➣ *3 times— OR — +1

docs.title: Notes
docs.text: • This card has to be played before rolling the die. It cannot be played after the die was rolled and the result of that roll is already known.

docs.title: Frenzy
docs.text:
Expert Fire Spell

This unit ignores the of the attacked * unit. 0 ➣ * 2 ➣ * or 4 ➣ * or or — OR — +1

docs.title: Frost Ring
docs.text:
Expert Water Spell

Select a space on the Combat board. 2 units adjacent to this space suffer: 0 ➣ 1 2 ➣ 2 4 ➣ 3 — OR — +1

docs.title: Notes
docs.text: • The from Frost Ring also applies to friendly units.

docs.title: Haste
docs.text:
Basic Air Spell

Until the end of the Combat, the selected unit gains: 0 ➣ +1 1 ➣ +2 2 ➣ +3 — OR — +1

docs.title: Notes
docs.text: • 1 On the small battlefield, only the initiative of the unit is increased, not its movement range. On the Battlefield Expansion, the initiative is used to determine the movement range, therefore a unit under this spell has its movement range increased as well.

docs.title: Implosion
docs.text:
Expert Earth Spell

The selected unit suffers: 1 ➣ 2 3 ➣ 4 5 ➣ 6 — OR — +1

docs.title: Notes
docs.text: • To play this spell, as least one spell power needs to also be played.

docs.title: Inferno
docs.text:
Expert Fire Spell

Select a space. Now roll and Attack die *. All units on this and the adjacent spaces take 1 for every "+1" rolled. 0 ➣ *once 1 ➣ *twice 2 ➣ *4 times— OR — +1

docs.title: Notes
docs.text: • The from Inferno also applies to friendly units.

docs.title: Lightning Bolt
docs.text:
Basic Air Spell

The selected unit suffers: 0 ➣ 2 1 ➣ 3 2 ➣ 4 — OR — +1

docs.title: Magic Arrow
docs.text:
Basic Spell

The selected unit suffers: 0 ➣ 1 1 ➣ 2 2 ➣ 3 — OR — +1

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
• Magic Arrow is considered a basic spell, despite having a magic symbol in each corner.
  • Magic Arrow can benefit from spell power bonus to any school of magic, but it can only be affected by a single school of magic at a time.
  • 1 If a unit ignores a specific school of magic (it's immune to spells of that school of magic), it can not ignore the Magic Arrow.

docs.title: Mirth
docs.text:
Expert Water Spell

You can reroll each of your Attack dice once. During: 0 ➣ This Activation 2 ➣ This Combat round 4 ➣ This Combat— OR — +1

docs.title: Misfortune
docs.text:
Basic Fire Spell

Play immediately when the selected * enemy unit is attacking. Negate an Attack die result or an additional from any card. 0 ➣ * 1 ➣ * or 2 ➣ * or or — OR — +1

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
• The card has to be played immediately after declaring the attack, before other cards are played.
  • The result of the Attack die roll is negated, as well as all future effects that increase the of the attacking unit.
  • Misfortune can not be played to negate effects of cards that were already played and have already instead the of the attacking unit. The players should mutually agree if they can no longer play Misfortune after the other effects were played, or if the opponent gets to take his played -enhancing cards back into their hand.

docs.title: Prayer
docs.text:
Expert Water Spell

The selected unit gains * , , or : 0 ➣ *+1 2 ➣ *+2 4 ➣ *+3— OR — +1

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
• Prayer only increases one of the three values, the caster gets to choose which one.
  • Prayer can be cast at any point during the Combat as an instant. This way a player may increase the initiative of a unit outside of their turn, causing the turn order to be adjusted immediately.

docs.title: Precision
docs.text:
Basic Air Spell

When attacking a non-adjacent unit, the selected unit ignores the combat penalties and gains: 0 ➣ +1 1 ➣ +2 2 ➣ +3 — OR — +1

docs.title: Remove Obstacle
docs.text:
Basic Water Spell

Remove * obstacles (except units) from the Combat board. 0 ➣ *1 1 ➣ *2 2 ➣ *3— OR — +1

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
• Units can not be removed by this spell, despite counting as obstacles for movement purposes.
  • Only the wall, the gate, and obstacle markers (on the large battlefield) may be removed by this spell.

docs.title: Resurrection
docs.text:
Expert Earth Spell

Cancel an attack that would reduce your * unit's to 0. You can cast this spell immediately after the enemy unit's attack. 0 ➣ * 2 ➣ * or 4 ➣ * or or — OR — +1

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
• Only damage from an attack can be nullified. If the health points are reduced by other means of damage (such as abilities, spells, specialties, etc.), Resurrection cannot be played.
  • If damage from an attack is nullified, the resurrected unit will not retaliate, even if it has not performed a retaliation this round.

docs.title: Sacrifice
docs.text:
Expert Fire Spell

Redirect the dealt to the selected * unit to any other of your units. 0 ➣ * 2 ➣ * or 4 ➣ * or or — OR — +1

docs.text:

When attacking a unit, roll an Attack die * and apply all the results (except for a "-1"). After resolving this , draw 1 card. 0 ➣ *twice 2 ➣ *4 times 4 ➣ *6 times— OR — +1

docs.title: Slow

Until the end of the Combat, the selected unit suffers: 0 ➣ -1 1 ➣ -2 2 ➣ -3 — OR — +1

Expert Earth Spell

docs.title: Notes
docs.text: • 1 If the selected town already has a hero in it, and the teleporting hero would not be able to move out of the city during this turn, they can not teleport to the town.

docs.title: Black Dragons
docs.text: FewPackNeutral Statistics Few Pack Neutral Town Dungeon Dungeon Neutral Tier Type 6 8 5 3 3 2 8 8 7 11 15 9 Cost 19  1  33  2  30  Abilities  Reduce   taken by this unit from   by 2 to a minimum of 0.  Ignore any   effects and   from Specialty.  Attack 2 spaces in a line. The first attack resolves normally, and the second has 2  .

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
• Pack - The effects of the player's own spells and specialties are also ignored.
  • Pack - Specialties are the hero-specific cards (Ⅰ, Ⅳ, and Ⅵ).
  • Neutral - The first attack targets a unit directly in front of the Black Dragons. The second attack targets the unit directly behind the primary target in a straight line. There is no choice here.
  • Neutral - The target of the second attack does not carry out a retaliation attack against the Black Dragons, as it is not adjacent to it.
  • Neutral - Should the Black Dragons attack two units in a line, both of the attacks are resolved first. The retaliation attack will only be carried out after the secondary attack of Black Dragons has been resolved.
  • Neutral - Should the Black Dragons attack a unit, and the unit directly behind the primary target in a straight line happens to be a friendly unit, then the friendly unit will be the target of their secondary attack.
  • Neutral - Should the Black Dragons attack a Wall, no secondary attack will take place. Units behind the Wall are protected. Should they attack a unit directly in front of a Wall, the Wall will not take any damage.

docs.title: Genies

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
• Few - Should the Genies use their alternative action, they are not allowed to move, attack or defend.
  • Few - Exactly 3 cards are discarded from the deck.
  • Pack - Up to 3 cards are discard from the deck. The cards are discarded one after another. The player may decide to stop discarding cards at any time before they reach 3 cards and take a spell discarded this way to their hand.
  • Few and Pack - Should there not be enough cards to discard from the deck, the cards already discarded by the currently resolving ability are used to form the new discard pile. The old discard pile is then shuffled back into deck, and the remaining cards are discarded. The spell is then taken from the discarded cards.

docs.title: Gold Dragons
docs.text: FewPackNeutral Statistics Few Pack Neutral Town Rampart Rampart Neutral Tier Type 5 6 6 3 3 3 9 10 9 10 16 10 Cost 22  1  30  2  42  Abilities  Attack 2 spaces in a line. The first attack resolves normally, and the second has 2  ,  Attack 2 spaces in a line. The first attack resolves normally, and the second has 3  .  Attack 2 spaces in a line. The first attack resolves normally, and the second has 3  .

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
• The first attack targets a unit directly in front of the Gold Dragons. The second attack targets the unit directly behind the primary target in a straight line. There is no choice here.
  • The target of the second attack does not carry out a retaliation attack against the Gold Dragons, as it is not adjacent to it.
  • Should the Gold Dragons attack two units in a line, both of the attacks are resolved first. The retaliation attack will only be carried out after the secondary attack of Gold Dragons has been resolved.
  • Should the Gold Dragons attack a unit, and the unit directly behind the primary target in a straight line happens to be a friendly unit, then the friendly unit will be the target of their secondary attack.
  • Should the Gold Dragons attack a Wall, no secondary attack will take place. Units behind the Wall are protected. Should they attack a unit directly in front of a Wall, the Wall will not take any damage.

docs.text:
• Pack and Neutral - Liches can only do one extra attack, not more.

  • Pack and Neutral - Should the Liches attack an adjacent unit, and afterwards use the secondary attack on a unit that is adjacent to their original target, both of those attacks are resolved first. The retaliation attack will only be carried out after the secondary attack of Liches has been resolved.
  • 1 2 Pack and Neutral - Only on the large Battlefield: Should the Liches attack an adjacent unit, and both them, and their target have a common adjacent enemy to them, and this common adjacent unit is dealt damage from the secondary attack, both, the original target and the target of their secondary attack perform a retaliation attack against the Liches.

docs.text:
• The expert effect may be played either from hand, or from the field. This does, however, not add the two effects, and the ability is put into the discard pile after being played.
  • See Permanent Effect

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text: • This ability is active during each ranged attack of the Combat round, which means that it applies to both attacks of Elves and Marksmen.

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text: • Armorer may also be played outside of Combat, in order to draw a card. In such case, the defense bonus is unused and lost.

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text:
• If multiple enemy units share the same (lowest) initiative, the player can choose which of those units should this ability deal damage to.
  • The expert effect can only be played when the Ballista activates, which can only happen at the beginning of each Combat round.
  • Without an active Ballista, only the basic effect of this ability can be resolved.
  • In combination with Astrologers proclaim week of the Ammo Cart the expert effect will deal 3 times 2 damage, so 6 damage in total.

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text:
• If the player already has a dwelling, they draw cards from both, the and Neutral decks.
  • The recruitment costs for neutral units can be found on the card of the respective unit.
  • For recruitment that happens as a result of using this ability, the recruitment token shall not be flipped. This means this ability may be used even after the player has already recruited units during this round.
  • 1 When played with miniatures (e.g. such as when playing on the large battlefield), this ability cannot be used to recruit units from a faction controller by another player, nor to recruit neutral units that are already recruited by another player. Should a player draw such card, that may not be recruited, they shall draw a replacement card instead.

docs.title: Uwagi

• The expert effect may be played either from hand, or from the field. This does, however, not add the two effects, and the ability is put into the discard pile after being played.
