docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text:
• The expert effect can only be played when the First Aid Tent activates, which can only happen at the beginning of each Combat round.
  • Without an active First Aid Tent, only the basic effect of this ability can be resolved.

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text:
• If both players are resolving cards with effects at the start of the Combat (e.g. playing Intelligence), the attacker (or the player with the initiative token) may resolve their card first.
  • This ability can only be played at the start of the Combat itself, not at the start of any Combat round.

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text:
• Fields are considered empty if they can not provide an effect or no longer provide an effect. This means that fields with black cubes or the player's faction cubes count as empty.
  • The additional Movement point may also be granted to the secondary hero.
  • The additional Movement point is single use effect, it does not permanently increase the maximum movement points of a hero.

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text:
• The expert effect allows to reroll every die that the player rolls during their entire turn. This includes every attack die during all of the fights during their turn.
  • This ability may be played during an enemy's turn, only in a fight, and only if the player hero is defending themselves. It can only be played during the activation of a friendly unit.

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text:
• Only the heroes belonging to the Necropolis Faction may play Necromancy.
  • Necromancy may only be used to reinforce units that belong to the Necropolis Faction.
  • The reinforcing of units via Necromancy can also take place when the player does not have the Citadel built in their town.
  • If a hero that does not belong to the Necropolis Faction should draw it from the Ability deck, they may put it into the discard pile and draw another card instead. They may also choose to keep the card, they may, however, not play it.

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text: • Offense may also be played outside of Combat, in order to draw a card. In such case, the attack bonus is unused and lost.

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text:
• The player's primary hero must take part in the Combat. It is not possible to play Resistance if the enemy hero is in Combat with neutral units or another player.
  • Resistance can nullify any spells cast by the enemy, not just those that target friendly units.

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text:
• Sorcery may also be played without playing a spell, in order to draw a card. In such case, the spell power bonus is unused and lost.
  • Sorcery may be played to first draw a card. A spell drawn in this way may then be played immediately after being drawn and receive the spell power bonus granted by Sorcery.

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text:
• The expert effect may be played either from hand, or from the field. This does, however, not add the two effects, and the ability is put into the discard pile after being played.
  • See Permanent Effect

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text:
• After playing Angel Wings, the hero may move through borders and blocked fields. They may, however, not end their movement on a blocked field.
  • See Blocked Field

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text:
• This artifact only reduces the recruitment cost, it does not allow for an additional recruitment to take place. During a round in which the player already recruited units (their population marker is already turned over), the discount effect provides no benefit, as the player may no longer recruit.
  • The recruitment discount may be played in combination with cards that allow recruitment (e.g. Necromancy).
  • Should the player recruit outside of their turn, the effect of the Arms of Legion may not be used.

By to zrobić, gracz musi mieć w Mieście Siedlisko odpowiedniego poziomu i koszt Rekrutowania. Niezakupione karty należy wtasować z powrotem do odpowiednich talii.

Cześć, Bohaterze! Chcesz balonik? Jestem Charle, Tańczący Clown. Mam tu orków, trolle i inne niespodzianki. I baloniki we wszystkich kolorach!

Hello silence, my old friend.I've come to chat with you again.

docs.title: Explorers
docs.text:
Astrologowie Ogłaszają

During this round, players do not draw cards at the start of their turns. Instead, each player draws cards up their . Then, each of them may discard any number of cards. For every 3 cards discarded this way, they can Remove one Statistic card and replace it with an Empowered Statistic card of the same type.

"We are explorers. The ones to delve into the unknown regions of experience. Demons to some, angels to others."

docs.text:
Astrologowie Ogłaszają

Ten efekt trwa do następnej rundy Astrologów.Raz w turze każdy gracz może przerzucić kość Skarbów albo kość Zasobów.

By gnollem być, szkielety musisz miećTo żadna już tajemnicaDo sławy się ten Sandro znów pniePrzez całe dnie Hełm Czaszki kradnieJam nie łasica, a kawał licza!

docs.title: Paskudnej Plagi
docs.text:
Astrologowie Ogłaszają

Wszyscy gracze odwracają kartę wybranej jednostki ze strony "Grupy" na stronę "Garstki", jeśli to możliwe.

Pstryk! Ginie połowa populacji.

docs.title: Unexpected Reinforcements
docs.text:
Astrologowie Ogłaszają

Each player can immediately search the Neutral Units deck and Recruit 1 chosen unit associated with their faction for free. Each player still needs to have the corresponding dwelling built in their town.

"My Lord, my Lady! We're at your command!"

docs.title: Białego Kruka
docs.text:
Astrologowie Ogłaszają

Każdy gracz natychmiast rzuca 1 kością Zasobów i rozpatruje jej wynik.

— Dokąd pomykasz ptaszyno z mych snów?— Do Eeofolu, Deyji, Wymiaru między wymiarami... A co, chcesz się przelecieć?

docs.title: Wild Debauchery
docs.text:
Astrologowie Ogłaszają

At the beginning of the next Resource round, all players gain 5 less .

Sit down, there's a party in the tavern today!We are thirsty again!La la la!We drink for a week of Wild DebaucheryFor seven days now!La la la!

docs.text:
Pole to pojedyncza komórka Kafelka.

Name Type Effect Dragon Utopia Flaggable Effects depend on the Scenario. Mine Flaggable When flagged, increases the specific resource income (shown on the field). The first player to flag the Mine also gains its income immediately. There are following types of Mines:+5 income+2 income+1 income Obelisk Flaggable Effects depend on the Scenario. When you Flag this Field, do not remove any enemy Faction Cubes; multiple players may have a Faction Cube on this Field. Random Town Flaggable When revealed, all players roll 2 Resource dice. The highest roller chooses an unused Faction. The random Town is defended by Units from that Faction. They have a "Pack" of , two "Packs" of , and two "Fews" of Units. The Unit is chosen by the player who controls the Units during that Combat.When flagged, increases income by 10. The first player to flag the Town also gains its income immediately. Settlement Flaggable Works as a spawn point for Secondary Heroes or Main Heroes that have been defeated.Works the same way as a mine, but the player can choose which resource income to increase. The settlement is then marked with a token of the chosen resource.— OR —Reinforce one of your or Units immediately for half the cost, rounded up. The first player to flag the settlement Reinforces that Unit for free. Star Axis Flaggable You may Remove one of your Statistic cards from your hand and replace it with an Empowered one of the same type. When you Flag this Field, do not remove any enemy Faction Cubes; multiple players may have a Faction Cube on this Field. Town Flaggable When flagged, the enemy Secondary Heroes or Main Heroes that have been defeated cannot spawn here.Flagging an enemy town does prevent the enemy player from using it, nor does it grant any access to the Town board or Faction Units to the player who flagged it.Flagging a Town can cause Player Elimination win condition, and some scenarios may have extra rules and rewards attached to flagging Towns. 2 Resources Visitable Roll 2 Resource Dice and choose the bonus from one of them. Artifact Visitable Search(2) the Artifact Deck Fountain of Youth Visitable Gain token. Gain +1 for this turn. Grail Visitable Gain a Grail Token. Only one Grail Token can exist in the game, do not gain another if this Field’s Black Cube is removed or if there are multiple Grail Fields. The Token’s effects are described in the Scenario’s description. Hill Fort Visitable You may immediately Reinforce one of your or Units. The Reinforcement cost is reduced by 3 to a minimum of 0. Learning Stone Visitable Gain one . Library Visitable 🚧 Magic Spring Visitable You may look at the top 3 Cards of your Discard Pile and return one of them to your Hand. Return the remaining cards to the top of your Discard Pile in any order. Market of Time Visitable Remove one card from your hand. Then Search(2) the Ability, Spell, or Artifact Deck. Mystical Garden Visitable Gain 2 .— OR —Gain 1 . Pandora's Box Visitable Roll 2 Treasure Dice and choose 1 result to gain.— OR —Roll 2 Resource Dice and choose 1 result to gain. Prison Visitable Gain a Secondary Hero. Place their model on this Field. If you already have a Secondary Hero, gain 3 instead. Redwood Observatory Visitable Discover a face down Tile adjacent to this one. Resources Visitable Roll a Resource Die and gain the indicated Resources. Scholar Visitable Roll 1 Attack Die. Depending on the result, do the following:+1 - Gain a Statistic Card of your choice or Remove a Statistic Card from your hand.0 - Draw 2 Cards from the Ability Deck, gain one of them and discard the other.-1 - Draw 2 Cards from the Spell Deck, gain one of them and discard the other. Shrine of Magic Gesture Visitable Pay 3 to Search(2) the Spell Deck. Shrine of Magic Incantation Visitable Search(2) the Spell Deck. Temple Visitable Gain token. Tree of Knowledge Visitable You may 3 or 10 to gain 2 . University Visitable 6 to Search(4) the Ability Discard Pile Warrior's Tomb Visitable Search(2) Artifacts twice, then gain token twice. Water Wheel Visitable Gain 3 . Windmill Visitable Gain 1 . Witch Hut Visitable Choose one:Remove an Ability card from your hand— OR —look at the top card of the Ability Deck and put that card into your hand or into the Ability Deck Discard Pile. Black Market Revisitable Look at the top 4 cards from the Artifact Discard Pile. You may buy one of them for:5 if it is a Minor Artifact7 if it is a Major Artifact10 if it is a Relic Artifact Sanctuary Revisitable Heroes on this Field cannot be attacked by other Heroes. Friendly Heroes can move through enemy Heroes on this Field but cannot stop here. Stables Revisitable Gain +1 for this turn. Tavern Revisitable You can 7 to gain a Secondary Hero. Place their model on this Field. Then, choose one enemy player to discard 1 random card from their hand. Trading Post Revisitable Choose one:Trade resources— OR —Remove a card— OR —Buy a War Machine War Machine Factory Revisitable Buy a War Machine

Visitable Field

docs.text: • Towns are always located in the center of a Starting Tile

• Ⅰ and Ⅳ - this can only be played on a pack of Skeletons or Zombies, adding another amount to them, named "Horde".
  • Ⅳ - the abilities of the Pack of Zombies become inactive if they are upgraded to a "Horde". Once the "Horde" is defeated and they become a "Pack" again, their abilities function as usual.
  • Ⅵ - can be playedon "Few", "Pack", or even "Horde" of Skeletons.
  • 1 Ⅵ - If the Skeletons are upgraded to a "Legion", they may be further upgraded to a "Pack" or a "Horde", but the "Legion" stays on top and its statistics are applied until defeated.

• Ⅰ - Only 2 units are dealt to and this cannot be changed by .
  • Ⅰ and Ⅵ - The primary target must be dealt the amount of damage that is printed on the leftmost side. The numbers printed second and third may be applied to the secondary and tertiary target in any order. The order does not need to strictly follow the order of distances from the primary target.
  • Ⅰ - The 0 on the third damage position allows the player to deal 1 to two units that have a friendly unit between them, as the friendly unit may be assigned the 0.

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text:
• A blocked field is fully enclosed by a thick border and heroes are not allowed to enter it in general.
  • 1 Should a hero be allowed to enter a blocked field due to an effect, they may only pass through. That means that they are required to immediately use another movement point during the same turn to move out of the blocked field. If they would not be able to leave the field, they are not allowed to enter it.
  • 1 Should a hero need to retreat back to a blocked field, they are allowed to do so, as long as they have a spare movement point that they can use to also move out of the blocked field during the same turn. If they have no movement points left, they retreat back to the field they were standing on before moving to the blocked field instead.
  • A hero is not allowed to end their turn on a blocked field.
  • 1 A field that is occupied by a player's hero may be used by the player's other hero to pass through. This means the hero needs to have another movement point available after moving to the field. Fields occupied by the player's heroes follow the same rules as blocked fields.

  1. Not officially confirmed by game designers, and is therefore considered a Community rule. ↩↩↩

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text:
• A paralyzed unit skips its next activation. Instead of activating, the token is removed from it.
  • The token is removed prematurely if the paralyzed unit receives damage. An attack that does not apply any damage does not count towards this.
  • If the paralyzed unit received damage from an attack, it will retaliate (if not done so prior during this Combat round).

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text:
• A card with a permanent effect is played from hand, just like any other card. The cards stays on the field after being played, its effect lasting continuously, and it does not go to the discard pile.
  • The player may decide to put an active permanent card into their discard pile. This stops the card effect immediately.
  • Each player can only have a single active permanent card at any time. Should they play a new one, the currently active one goes into their discard pile and the newly played card takes its place.

docs.title: Tryb Starcia
docs.text:
A fully competitive mode for 2-3 players.

Name Players Description All For One 3 Three life-long friends become enemies, when each inherits a portion of the kingdom, following the King’s death. You must show your former friends how to rule... through conquest. Brave New World 2-3 A great upheaval shook the very foundations of the world, breaking apart continents and dividing territories in new breaking apart continents and dividing territories in new ways. After the earth stood still once more, the people crawled out from their hiding places and have begun rebuilding this Brave New World. Carpe Diem 2 A few years back, the Gods decided they no longer wanted any part in this world. Now there is total anarchy. Everybody blames everyone else for the gods abandoning them. While sitting in the throne room, you decided you are the only person fit to rule. Dwarven Gold 2-3 Dwarven gold madness swept the region when Invis Smythers (renowned Dwarven miner) struck it lucky when he found a gold vein worth 75,000 gold pieces. Local lords have started mounting expeditions. Manifest Destiny 3 The neighboring lands have become increasingly more crowded. Only one kingdom is fit to rule the others. It is time to show the other petty nobles it is your manifest destiny to rule this land. Monk’s Retreat 2 The monks who ruled this area of the world for years, have finally been pushed back to their islands. As one of the lords just freed by the monk’s retreat, you feel it is up to you to unite these lands under your rule. Search For The Grail 2-3 The Grail is said to have been lost somewhere in the area, and you have been charged with finding and retrieving it. But beware! The minions of your enemies are also seeking to lay their hands on it!

docs.title: Kampania
docs.text:
A single player mode of interconnected Scenarios against an enemy AI.

Name Scenarios Faction Description Long Live The Queen 1. Homecoming2. Guardian Angels3. Steadwick’s Liberation Castle Our landing has confirmed both our rumors and fears. With the death of my father, Erathia’s lands are being greedily divided by her neighbors. Dragon’s Blood 1. Savaging The Scavengers2. Blood Of The Dragon Father3. Blood Thirsty Dungeon Overlord Mutare, an ambitious Nighon Lady, wishes to take her rightful place among the ranks of powerful Nighon Lords. In Nighon, you don’t inherit your lands - you take them from those too weak to hold them. Only the strong are fit to rule, and the bones of the weak litter the tunnels of Nighon. Rise Of The Necromancer 1. Target2. Master3. Duke Alarice Necropolis Sandro must fight his way past his old master and several other lords who want the artifacts he carries. Once in Deyja he will make allies and soon rise to the top of the Deyja hierarchy. The Dragon Slayer 1. Crystal Dragons2. Rust Dragons3. Faerie Dragons4. Azure Dragons Tower The way of a Dragon Slayer is harm’s way. To prove himself one, Dracon has to rise to a handful of perilous challenges, and defeating a Crystal Dragon is but the first step. Once it is made, Dracon will have to seek out and battle the greatest wyrm to have ever lived, as only when the Azure Dragon perishes can Dracon truly call himself a Dragon Slayer. Playing With Fire 1. Farming Towns2. March Of The Undead3. Burning Of Tatalia Fortress After the Restoration of Erathia, the necromantic cult of Lord Haart was made illegal, and its members went underground. Cultists resurrected their leader and decided to move to Tatalia.At the same time, after receiving lessons from clerics in Steadwick - the Erathian capital, the witch Adrienne returns to her homeland - Tatalia. Her brethren treat her with distrust also because she specializes in fire magic, rare in Tatalia. She discovers a Death Knight is turning the local population into a harvesting ground for Undead. Restore the land and hunt down this evil. Utter extermination of the undead plague is your ultimate goal. Dead-Cold Revenge 1. Search For A Killer2. Final Peace3. Agents Of Vengeance Rampart TWhen two AvLee lords are found dead, Gem and Gelu set out on their vengeful quest to seek justice. Their fates, however, unexpectedly lead them to find much more than they had hoped for. Will they manage to foil the sinister plot brewing on AvLee borders, or has the gruesome discovery come too late to stop the Necromancers’ schemes?

docs.title: Tryb Sojuszu
docs.text:
A 2 versus 2 team-based mode. You will need an expansion pack with a town to play a 4-player game.

Name Description Arrogance Once, centuries ago, the world was at peace. Four cultures lived in harmony and freely associated with each other. Then you came into power and realized things would be better for you if you took over the entire world. Tale Of Two Lands The continents of East and West Varesburg have decided to wage war one last time. Securing the resources of your continent (with help from your ally) and then moving on to the other as quickly as possible is the best strategy for the battle of the Varesburgs. The Challenge The king has just revealed that it is only a matter of months before he passes away. For that reason he announced that whoever rises to the challenge of building the grail structure in the capital city of Osha within the next six months will be anointed as his successor. The gauntlet has been thrown, will you take it up?

docs.title: Tryb Kooperacyjy
docs.text:
A Cooperative mode for 2-3 players where everyone shares the same goal.

Name Players Description Gelea’s Champions 2-3 You and your ally have been invaded by warlords from another world. The time has come to strike back. Gather your forces and make temporary alliances to pile up resources in order to save the realm! Unholy Quest 2-3 Deep below the surface lurk monsters, the likes of which no one has ever seen before. Word is that the monsters are preparing to rise from the depths and lay claim to the surface world. Go forth and slay their evil armies before they grow too large. You may be the world’s only hope!

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text: • Units that are protected from spells via Anti-Magic are also immune to area effects of spells (e.g. Fireball spell).

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text:
• If there are multiple units that the shortest path away from the unit under this spell, the player owning the unit decides the direction of movement and the target of the attack.
  • Friendly units can also be attacked by the unit under this spell.
  • The attack of the unit under this spell does trigger a retaliation attack, even if the attacked unit was a friendly one.

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text: • If no Attack die is rolled during the attack, it also does not show any results. This means that any units that have abilities based on the result of an Attack die roll do not trigger. (e.g. the Zombies does not increase, and the Mummies cannot set the Attack die to "-1").

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text:
• The from Chain Lightning also applies to friendly units.
  • If multiple units are the same distance away from the target of this spell, the caster chooses which one of them receives the second damage and which one receives the third.

• 1 It is uncertain what it meant by "effect" here.
  • 2 Cure can only be cast on a friendly unit.
  • 2 The removal of an effect is optional. A positive effect does not have to be removed and may therefore remain active.

• Magic Arrow is considered a basic spell, despite having a magic symbol in each corner.
  • Magic Arrow can benefit from spell power bonus to any school of magic, but it can only be affected by a single school of magic at a time.
  • 1 If a unit ignores a specific school of magic (it's immune to spells of that school of magic), it can not ignore the Magic Arrow.

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text:
• The card has to be played immediately after declaring the attack, before other cards are played.
  • The result of the Attack die roll is negated, as well as all future effects that increase the of the attacking unit.
  • Misfortune can not be played to negate effects of cards that were already played and have already instead the of the attacking unit. The players should mutually agree if they can no longer play Misfortune after the other effects were played, or if the opponent gets to take his played -enhancing cards back into their hand.

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text:
• Prayer only increases one of the three values, the caster gets to choose which one.
  • Prayer can be cast at any point during the Combat as an instant. This way a player may increase the initiative of a unit outside of their turn, causing the turn order to be adjusted immediately.

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text:
• Units can not be removed by this spell, despite counting as obstacles for movement purposes.
  • Only the wall, the gate, and obstacle markers (on the large battlefield) may be removed by this spell.

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text:
• Only damage from an attack can be nullified. If the health points are reduced by other means of damage (such as abilities, spells, specialties, etc.), Resurrection cannot be played.
  • If damage from an attack is nullified, the resurrected unit will not retaliate, even if it has not performed a retaliation this round.

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text: • 1 On the small battlefield, only the initiative of the unit is decreased, not its movement range. On the Battlefield Expansion, the initiative is used to determine the movement range, therefore a unit under this spell has its movement range decreased as well.

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text:
• Pack - The passive ability can be used at the moment when a friendly unit would be defeated.
  • Pack - See Resurrection Spell

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text:
• The effects of the player's own spells and specialties are also ignored.
  • Specialties are the hero-specific cards (Ⅰ, Ⅳ, and Ⅵ).

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text:
• Pack - The effects of the player's own spells and specialties are also ignored.
  • Pack - Specialties are the hero-specific cards (Ⅰ, Ⅳ, and Ⅵ).
  • Neutral - The first attack targets a unit directly in front of the Black Dragons. The second attack targets the unit directly behind the primary target in a straight line. There is no choice here.
  • Neutral - The target of the second attack does not carry out a retaliation attack against the Black Dragons, as it is not adjacent to it.
  • Neutral - Should the Black Dragons attack two units in a line, both of the attacks are resolved first. The retaliation attack will only be carried out after the secondary attack of Black Dragons has been resolved.
  • Neutral - Should the Black Dragons attack a unit, and the unit directly behind the primary target in a straight line happens to be a friendly unit, then the friendly unit will be the target of their secondary attack.
  • Neutral - Should the Black Dragons attack a Wall, no secondary attack will take place. Units behind the Wall are protected. Should they attack a unit directly in front of a Wall, the Wall will not take any damage.

docs.title: Dziki
docs.text: Statystyki Neutralne Miasto Neutralne Poziom Typ 2 0 4 6 Koszt 4  Zdolności -

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text: • Pack and Neutral - Should the Cerberi attack a unit and there is only a friendly unit adjacent to their target, then the friendly unit will take the damage.

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text:
• Neutral - A -1 on the Attack die is always rerolled, even multiple times.
  • Neutral - When attacking neutral Manticores, the Manticores receive +2 , as both Attack dice will always end up as a 0 or a 1.

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text:
• Pack and Neutral - The Attack die may be rerolled until the number on the die no longer equals "0".
  • 1 Neutral - Should the Crusaders retaliate against a few Dread Knights, they're abilities cancel out and a single Attack die is rolled as if it was a regular attack.

docs.title: Zobacz też
docs.text:
• Lista Jednostek
  • Lista Miast

  1. Not officially confirmed by game designers, and is therefore considered a Community rule. ↩

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text: • The effect only triggers if the Crystal Dragons are in the player's unit deck, so they had to be recruited beforehand (e.g. by Diplomacy).

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text: • 1 Few - Should the Dread Knights attack neutral Crusaders, when the Crusaders retaliate against a few Dread Knights, they're abilities cancel out and a single Attack die is rolled as if it was a regular attack.

docs.title: Zobacz też
docs.text:
• Lista Jednostek
  • Lista Miast

  1. Not officially confirmed by game designers, and is therefore considered a Community rule. ↩

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text:
• The Attack die needs to be rolled even if the spell or specialty that was used was friendly.
  • 1 Dwarves ignore the card effect if they are the only target. If the effect also affects other units, the Dwarves do not ignore it.

docs.title: Zobacz też
docs.text:
• Lista Jednostek
  • Lista Miast

  1. Not officially confirmed by game designers, and is therefore considered a Community rule. ↩

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text: • Pack and Neutral - The Elves can attack at most one additional time, not more.

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text:
• If possible, the healing effect has to be chosen. The healing effect can not be skipped in favor of +1 .
  • The healing is applied right after activation.
  • Enchaters can not heal themselves.

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text:
• The 2 can be dealt to any unit on the Combat board.
  • The ability counting as a is only relevant when the Fearie Dragons are in the player's unit deck (e.g. after being recruited by Diplomacy).

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text: • Pack and Neutral - As long as Familiars are in play, the enemy player can only cast a spell if they can discard a card (the discard is treated as a cost of playing the spell). If they have no card to discard, they can not play any spells.

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text:
• Few and Pack - Only the spell effects are ignored. Other sources of effects will still work (e.g. artifacts).
  • Few and Pack - Friendly spell effects are also ignored.

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text:
• Few - Should the Genies use their alternative action, they are not allowed to move, attack or defend.
  • Few - Exactly 3 cards are discarded from the deck.
  • Pack - Up to 3 cards are discard from the deck. The cards are discarded one after another. The player may decide to stop discarding cards at any time before they reach 3 cards and take a spell discarded this way to their hand.
  • Few and Pack - Should there not be enough cards to discard from the deck, the cards already discarded by the currently resolving ability are used to form the new discard pile. The old discard pile is then shuffled back into deck, and the remaining cards are discarded. The spell is then taken from the discarded cards.

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text:
• Pack - First the +1 is added to the Attack die result, before other effects are applied, such as the effect of the Centaur's Axe.
  • Neutral - The player od the attacked unit gets to decide, where the unit moves. The new field must be empty and must not be adjacent to the Ghost Dragons. If there is no such field, the attacked unit stays in place.
  • Neutral - If the attacked unit was unable to move away, retaliation attack will take place. Otherwise it would not take place, as the unit would not longer be adjacent to the Ghost Dragons.

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text:
• The first attack targets a unit directly in front of the Gold Dragons. The second attack targets the unit directly behind the primary target in a straight line. There is no choice here.
  • The target of the second attack does not carry out a retaliation attack against the Gold Dragons, as it is not adjacent to it.
  • Should the Gold Dragons attack two units in a line, both of the attacks are resolved first. The retaliation attack will only be carried out after the secondary attack of Gold Dragons has been resolved.
  • Should the Gold Dragons attack a unit, and the unit directly behind the primary target in a straight line happens to be a friendly unit, then the friendly unit will be the target of their secondary attack.
  • Should the Gold Dragons attack a Wall, no secondary attack will take place. Units behind the Wall are protected. Should they attack a unit directly in front of a Wall, the Wall will not take any damage.

docs.title: Złote Golemy
docs.text: Statystyki Neutralne Miasto Neutralne Poziom Typ 3 2 6 5 Koszt 14  Zdolność  Zmniejsz   zadawane tej jednostce zaklęciami o 2 (maksymalnie do 0).

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text: • Pack - Only the Pack of Gremlins are a . Few Gremlins are a .

docs.title: Niziołki
docs.text: Statystyki Neutralne Miasto Neutralne Poziom Typ 2 0 3 6 Koszt 5  Zdolności  Rzuć 2 kośćmi Ataku i rozpatrz wyższy wyni. Zignoruj kary do Walki.

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text: • The player can freely decided whether the Harpies return back to their starting position after their attack.

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text:
• Pack and Neutral - The attacks take place after each other and each of those attacks has a separate Attack Die roll. The player decides the order of attacks.
  • Pack and Neutral - Neither of the attacks triggers a Retaliation Attack. The symbol affects both target of the Hydras.
  • 1 Pack and Neutral - Hydras can not attack a unit and a Wall at the same time, only one or the other.

docs.title: Zobacz też
docs.text:
• Lista Jednostek
  • Lista Miast

  1. Not officially confirmed by game designers, and is therefore considered a Community rule. ↩

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text:
• Pack and Neutral - Liches can only do one extra attack, not more.
  • Pack and Neutral - The extra attacks of Liches also trigger when attacking an adjacent target.
  • Pack and Neutral - Should the Liches attack a unit and there is only a friendly unit adjacent to their target, then the friendly unit will be the target of their secondary attack (even if the unit is undead).
  • Pack and Neutral - Should the Liches attack an adjacent unit, and there is no other unit adjacent to the target, the Liches deal the damage of the second attack to themselves.
  • 1 Pack and Neutral - Should the Liches attack an adjacent unit, and there is another friendly unit adjacent to the target, they may target themselves for the second attack.
  • Pack and Neutral - Should the Liches attack an adjacent unit, and afterwards use the secondary attack on a unit that is adjacent to their original target, both of those attacks are resolved first. The retaliation attack will only be carried out after the secondary attack of Liches has been resolved.
  • 1 2 Pack and Neutral - Only on the large Battlefield: Should the Liches attack an adjacent unit, and both them, and their target have a common adjacent enemy to them, and this common adjacent unit is dealt damage from the secondary attack, both, the original target and the target of their secondary attack perform a retaliation attack against the Liches.

docs.title: Zobacz też
docs.text:
• Lista Jednostek
  • Lista Miast

  1. Not officially confirmed by game designers, and is therefore considered a Community rule. ↩↩

  2. Exceptions for specific game modes. This explanation is not valid for all game modes. The specific variant for the game mode is mentioned in the text. ↩

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text:
• Pack - A spell will only receive the +1 by the Magi, if it's the player's first spell of the current Combat round and it was played either during the activation of Magi or later.
  • Neutral - Should a random card be discarded, the card can not be chosen. In a multiplayer game, another player picks the random card.

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text: • Pack and Neutral - Should the Magogs attack a unit and there is only a friendly unit adjacent to their target, then the friendly unit will take the 1 .

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text:
• Pack - Only the value printed on the target unit's card is ignored, bonuses provided by other cards are still valid.
  • Pack (Alternate) - See Paralysis
  • Neutral - When attacked by neutral Champions, the Manticores receive +2 , as both Attack dice will always end up as a 0 or a 1.

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text: • Pack and Neutral - The Marksmen can attack at most one additional time, not more.

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text:
• Few - after the Retaliation Attack, roll another die. The result of the die rolled as part of the attack does not apply to the ability.
  • See Paralysis

docs.title: Mumie
docs.text: Statystyki Neutralne Miasto Neutralne Poziom Typ 3 1 4 5 Koszt 8  Zdolności  Zignoruj wynik z  kości Ataku.   Gdy Mumie są atakowane, obróć kość Ataku przeciwnika na wynik „-1”.

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text:
• Gracz nadal rzuca kością Ataku, ponieważ inne efekty związane z jej wynikiem mogą mieć zastosowanie.
  • Atak na Mumie ustawia tylko pierwotną kość Ataku na „-1”. Po rzucie może ona być zmodyfikowana przez efekty pozwalające na przerzucenia.

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text:
• The effect can be used at the end of each of the player's turns, as long as the Nomads are in the player's unit deck (e.g. after being recruited by Diplomacy).
  • After using the , the Nomads are not put away, but stay in the player's unit deck.
  • Fields are considered empty if they can not provide an effect or no longer provide an effect. This means that fields with black cubes or the player's faction cubes count as empty.

docs.title: Chłopi
docs.text: Statystyki Neutralne Miasto Neutralne Poziom Typ 1 0 2 3 Koszt 3  Zdolności  Na początku każdej rundy Zasobów zyskujesz 3  .

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text: • Efekt stosuje się jedynie wtedy, gdy Chłopi są w talii jednostek gracza, więc najpierw trzeba ich zrekrutować (np. przez Dyplomację).

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text: • Neutral - As long as Familiars are in play, the enemy player can only cast a spell if they can discard a card (the discard is treated as a cost of playing the spell). If they have no card to discard, they can not play any spells.

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text:
• Pack - Should the Pit Lords use their alternative action, they are not allowed to move, attack or defend.
  • Pack - Should the Pit Lords summon Few Demons, they have to be placed adjacent to the Pit Lords.
  • Pack - Should the Pit Lords reinforce Few Demons to a Pack of Demons, there is no recruitment cost to be paid.
  • Pack - The summoned Demons will activate during the Combat round when they were summoned, as long as their initiative is lower or equal to the initiative of the Pit Lords. If the initiative is higher, they are treated as if they were already activated during this Combat round.
  • Pack - The summoned or reinforced Demons stay in the player's army after the end of the Combat.
  • Pack - The Pit Lords may only summon or reinforce Demons once per Combat.

docs.title: Rozbójnicy

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text:
• Neutral - A Necropolis player can reinforce their unit during ongoing Combat. Any damage present on the Few side of the unit is transferred to the Pack side.
  • Neutral - The reinforcement is free and does not need to be paid.

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text:
• Pack - Only the Pack of Titans are a . Few Titans are a .
  • Few and Pack - Friendly effects are also ignored.
  • Few and Pack - Titans ignore the effects of Buckler of the Gnoll King and Greater Gnoll's Flail, but the effects still apply.
  • Few and Pack - Should the first effect of the Orb of Inhibition be played, the Titans will also not be receiving any damage from spells, as the effect of the Orb of Inhibition works on spells in general and doesn't specifically target Titans.
  • 1 Few and Pack - Titans are immune to the effect of Disrupting Ray spell and the second effect of the Orb of Inhibition, because their ability is already in play at the time when the other effects are played.

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text:
• Zdolność jest stosowana zaraz po aktywacji Trolli.
  • Jeśli Trolle są atakowane przez Wiwerny, zarówno obrażenia jak i leczenie zachodzą jednocześnie. To oznacza, że Trolle usuwają do 2 .

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text: • Vampires do not heal when attacking a Wall. Destroying a Wall is considered an action and not an actual attack.

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text:
• The ability is applied right after the Wraiths are activated.
  • If Wraiths were attacked by Wyverns, both the damage and the healing take place simultaneously. Nothing happens for faction (Few and Pack) Wraiths, and the Neutral variant removes up to 1 .

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text:
• Few and Pack - Enemy units, that were attacked by the Wyverns, receive damage on each activation, as long as there is at least one faction cube on them.
  • Few and Pack - If Trolls or Wraiths were attacked by the Wyverns, both the damage and the healing take place simultaneously. This means Trolls only remove up to 2 . Nothing happens for faction (Few and Pack) Wraiths, and their Neutral variant removes up to 1 .

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text: • The ability is triggered when a regular attack is performed against the Zombies, as well as a retaliation attack.

docs.title: ¿Qué Es Esto?
docs.text:
Una sencilla colección de las cartas contenidas en Heroes of Might and Magic 3: El Juego de Mesa, que también ofrece explicaciones extra sobre cómo funcionan algunas cartas o interactúan con otras.

De vez en cuando quiero ver lo que hacen algunas cartas, ya sea mientras teorizo sobre qué jugar, o incluso durante el juego, cuando quiero comprobar o hacer referencia a algo. Esta base de datos pretende ofrecer una forma sencilla de encontrar cualquier carta del juego, incluyendo una referencia visual e información adicional cuando sea necesario o aplicable.

docs.title: ¿Planes Futuros?
docs.text:
• Añadir explicaciones adicionales a todas las cartas que puedan necesitar alguna
  • Corregir los datos incorrectos (todas las cartas se han incluido a mano, por lo que es posible que algunas contengan erratas u otras imprecisiones).

Habilidad

Durante esta ronda de Combate, tus unidades a Distancia gana +1 si la unidad objetivo no está adyacente.

Hasta el final de la siguiente ronda de Combate, tus unidades a Distancia ganan +1 y +1 si la unidad objetivo no está adyacente.

docs.text:

  • El efecto experto solo se puede jugar cuando se activa Ballesta, lo que solo puede ocurrir al comienzo de cada ronda de Combate.
  • Sin una Ballesta activa, solo se puede resolver el efecto básico de esta habilidad.

docs.text:
Habilidad

Por cada Vivienda que tengas, roba 1 carta de la Unidad Neutral correspondiente. Puedes Reclutar una de estas unidades si su coste de Reclutamiento..

Salta el Combate con Unidades Neutrales en una zona cuya Dificultad de Zona sea igual al nivel de tu Héroe. Visita el lugar. Este Héroe no gana Experiencia.

docs.title: Notas
docs.text:
• Si el jugador ya tiene una vivienda , roba cartas de ambos mazos Neutrales, el y el .
  • Los costes de reclutamiento de las unidades neutrales se encuentran en la ficha de la unidad correspondiente.
  • Para el reclutamiento que ocurre como resultado del uso de esta habilidad, la ficha de reclutamiento no será volteada. Esto significa que esta habilidad puede utilizarse incluso después de que el jugador ya haya reclutado unidades durante esta ronda.
  • 1 Cuando se juega con miniaturas (ej. cuando se juega en el gran campo de batalla), esta habilidad no puede utilizarse para reclutar unidades de una facción controlada por otro jugador, ni para reclutar unidades neutrales que ya estén reclutadas por otro jugador. Si un jugador roba una carta de este tipo, que no puede ser reclutada, deberá robar una carta de reemplazo en su lugar.

  • If a hero that does not belong to the Necropolis Faction should draw it from the Habilidad deck, they may put it into the discard pile and draw another card instead. They may also choose to keep the card, they may, however, not play it.

docs.title: Banda del Embajador
docs.text:
Artefacto Mayor

Por cada Vivienda que tengas, descubre 1 carta de la correspondiente Unidad Neutral. Puedes Reclutar una de estas unidades.— O — Repite la tirada de un dado.

Te detienes para ayudar a un diplomático con un eje roto a solucionar su problema. En agradecimiento, te regala una faja con propiedades mágicas que dice que te permitirá, "ayudar a la gente a ver las cosas a tu manera."

docs.title: Alas de Ángel
docs.text:

Sin querer saber realmente donde está el Ángel, a cuyas alas pertecenen, es decir, tomas las alas y te vas rápidamente.

docs.title: Notas
docs.text:
• Después de jugar Alas de Ángel, el Héroe puede moverse a través de las fronteras y los campos bloqueados. Sin embargo, no puede terminar su movimiento en un campo bloqueado.
  • Ver Zona Bloqueada

docs.title: Brazos de Legión
docs.text:

docs.text:

  • The recruitment discount may be played in combination with cards that allow recruitment (e.g. Nigromancia).
  • Si el jugador recluta fuera de su turno, no se puede usar el efecto de los Brazos de Legión.

Repite cualquier dado.— O — Coloca un dado de o por el lado de tu elección.

docs.title: Colgante de la Dicha Celestial
docs.text:
Artefacto Reliquia

Descarta X cartas de la mano para ganar +X .- O - Elimina esta carta y gana +3 .

Tras rescatar a una hechicera de una tumba maldita, ella recompensa tu heroísmo con un exquisito collar de joyas.

docs.title: Hacha del Centauro
docs.text:
Artefacto Menor

Triplica el resultado del dado de Ataque outcome.— O — +1

Ves una pesada hacha clavada profundamente en el suelo. Tras varios intentos infructuosos de tu ejército por extraerla, agarras con fuerza el mango del hacha y tiras de ella sin esfuerzo.

docs.title: Notas
docs.text: • El resultado del dado de Ataque puede triplicarse para otros propósitos que no sean atacar, ej. para jugar el hechizo Infierno. En ese caso, el artefacto también puede ser jugado después de la tirada del dado de Ataque.

docs.title: Amuleto de Maná
docs.text:
Artefacto Menor

Descarta 2 cartas, luego roba 3 cartas.— O — Roba 2 cartas, luego descarta 1 carta.

Te topas con una caravana de gitanos que están festejando y fortificando sus cuerpos con hidromiel. Te llaman y te dicen: «Si demuestras que sabes bailar el Rama-Buta, te recompensaremos». Tú no lo sabes, pero lo intentas de todos modos. Se ríen histéricamente, pero admiran tu valentía, dándote un extraño encanto.

docs.title: Blasón del Valor
docs.text:
Artefacto Menor

Gana una ficha de .— O — Ignora el efecto de de una casilla.

Tras liberar a la princesa de un reino vecino de las garras de unos despreciables esclavistas, ella te otorga un Blasón del Valor.

docs.title: Corona de Dientes de Dragón
docs.text:
Artefacto Reliquia

Selecciona 2 cartas de Hehizol de tu pila de descarte y devuélvelas a tu mano.— O — Retira 1 de tu mano, luego Buscar(2) .

Tus tropas encuentran una corona. Te la entregan y te fijas en una inscripción. Dice así: "La inteligencia es mejor que la fuerza, y la magia vence a la fuerza. Presta atención a mis palabras y ganarás todos los combates."

docs.text:

  • Escudo de Escamas de Dragón
  • Tabardo de Ala de Dragón
  • Collar de Dientes de Dragón

  • Lengua Ígnea del Dragón Rojo

docs.title: Armadura de Escamas de Dragón
docs.text:
Artefacto Reliquia

+2 — O — +2

Te encuentras con un viejo armero que dice deberte un favor. Le pides que te lo conceda, y él une algunas escamas de dragón para formar una coraza bien hecha.

docs.text:
Artefacto Mayor

+2 — O — +2

Te encuentras con un viejo Armero, que dice deberte un favor. Le pides que te lo conceda, y él une unas escamas de dragón para formar un escudo bien hecho.

docs.title: Tabardo de Ala de Dragón
docs.text:
Artefacto Menor

Descarta 1 carta al azar de la mano del enemigo.— O — +1

Al librar a la campiña del horrible Dragón que se divertía comiéndose a los caballeros de la nobleza, se te honra con el Tabardo de Ala de Dragón.

docs.text:

docs.title: Bolsa Interminable de Oro
docs.text:
Artefacto Mayor

Gana 3 .— O — Retira esta carta, después gana 6 .

Una noble, separada de sus compañeros de viaje, te pide ayuda. Tras escoltarla hasta su casa, te recompensa con una bolsa llena de Oro.

docs.title: Monedero Interminable de Oro
docs.text:
Artefacto Mayor

Gana 3 .— O — Retira esta carta y descarta 2 cartas de tu mano, luego gana 8 .

En tus viajes, encuentras un bolso de cuero lleno de oro que perteneció a un gran rey guerrero que tenía la habilidad de transformar cualquier objeto inanimado en oro.

docs.title: Saco Interminable de Oro
docs.text:
Artefacto Reliquia

Gana 5 .— O — Retira esta carta, luego gana 8 .

Un pequeño duende baila alegremente alrededor de un saco mágico. Al ver que te acercas, se detiene en seco. El hombrecillo grita y golpea ferozmente con el pie, desvaneciéndose en el aire. Recordando el viejo dicho del duende: "Quien la encuentra, la guarda", coges el saco y te vas.

docs.title: Guantes Ecuestres
docs.text:
Artefacto Menor

Durante este Combate, tu unidad seleccionada gana +1 .— O — Tu Héroe gana +1 .

Una breve parada en una improbable posada rural da lugar a un intercambio de dinero, cuentos y, accidentalmente, equipaje. Encuentras un par de guantes mágicos en tu nueva mochila.

docs.title: Capa de Cristal Imperecedero
docs.text:
Artefacto Mayor

Descarta 3 cartas para ganar 2 .— O — Gana 1 .

Al refugiarte de una tormenta en una pequeña cueva, observas un pequeño trozo de cristal en una esquina. Te pica la curiosidad y descubres que se trata de una capa que, al romperla, vuelve a crecer misteriosamente. Decides llevarte la capa contigo.

docs.title: Ver También
docs.text:
• Vial de Mercurio Inacabable

  • Eversmoking Ring of Sulfur

  • Lista de Artefactos

docs.title: Vial de Mercurio Inacabable
docs.text:
Artefacto Mayor

Gana 1 .— O — Retira esta carta, después gana 2 .

Tras una breve parada en una torre de mago abandonada precipitadamente, descubres un frasco mágico de mercurio al que, como siempre, le queda un poco en el fondo. Reconociendo un tesoro cuando lo ves, lo tapas y te lo metes en el bolsillo.

docs.title: Ver También
docs.text:

  • Eversmoking Ring of Sulfur

docs.title: Anillo de Azufre Inextinguible
docs.text:
Artefacto Menor

Al inicio de cada ronda de Recursos, gana 1 .— O — Retira esta carta, después gana 2 .

🚧

docs.text:

docs.title: Glifo de Gallardía
docs.text:
Artefacto Menor

Gana una ficha de .— O — +1

Al librar a la campiña del horrible Minotauro que se divertía comiéndose a los Caballeros de los nobles, se te honra con el Glifo de Gallardía.

docs.title: Arco Dorado
docs.text:
Artefacto Mayor

Durante este Combate, tus unidades ignoran la penalización de combate.— O — Una unidad de tu elección gana +2 .

Un encuentro fortuito con un famoso Arquero te lleva a una partida de nudillos desnudos apostando su arco contra tu caballo. Tú ganas.

docs.title: Mangual del Gran Gnoll
docs.text:
Artefacto Menor

+2 Hasta el final del Combate, esta unidad sufre -1 (hasta un mínimo de 0).— O — +1

Un torpe Gnoll se ha suicidado con su propio mayal. Conociendo tu superior habilidad con esta arma, retiras con confianza el espectacular mayal de la criatura caída.

docs.title: Cabeza de Legión
docs.text:
Artefacto Mayor

Reduce el coste de Reclutamiento o Refuerzo de una unidad en 6 - hasta un mínimo de 0.— O — Gana 3 .

Registrando una ruina, te sorprende encontrar un trozo de la Estatua de la Legión. La desempolvas con cuidado antes de guardarla en tu mochila.

docs.title: Ver También
docs.text:
• Arms of Legion
  • Piernas de Legión
  • Escarcela de Legión

  • Torso de Legión

  • Lista de Artefactos

docs.title: Yelmo de la Divina Iluminación
docs.text:
Artefacto Reliquia

Gana .— O — Roba 2 cartas.

Ves un objeto brillante que sobresale del suelo. Envías a un miembro de tu grupo a investigar. Regresa con un yelmo dorado en las manos. Te das cuenta de que debe de ser el Yelmo de la Divina Iluminación, el único yelmo del que se rumorea que está hecho de oro macizo.

docs.title: Yelmo del Unicornio Alabastrino
docs.text:
Artefacto Menor

Devuelve 1 de tu elección de tu pila de descartes a tu mano.— O — Lanza un hechizo de la parte superior de la pila de descartes del mazo y Elimina esta carta.

Un calderero ambulante que necesita provisiones te ofrece un yelmo con un cuerno de unicornio en la parte superior a cambio de comida y agua. Aceptas y más tarde descubres que el yelmo es mágico.

docs.title: Reloj de Arena de la Hora Aciaga
docs.text:
Artefacto Menor

si el enemigo tiene , gana .— O — Lanza el dado de Ataque. Con un resultado "0", ganas .

Un giro inesperado en el paisaje te encuentra en medio de una escena espeluznante: buitres hurgando en los despojos de una terrible batalla. Al buscar entre los restos, encuentras un reloj de arena encantado.

docs.title: Carreta de Madera Inagotable
docs.text:
Artefacto Menor

Gain 2 .— OR — Remove this card, then gain 4 .

Pausing to rest and light a cook fire, you pull wood out of a nearby lumber cart. As you keep pulling wood from the cart, you notice its cargo does not shrink. You realize to your delight that the cart is enchanted, so you take it along.

docs.title: Carreta de Mineral Inagotable
docs.text:
Artefacto Menor

At the beginning of each Recursos round, gain 1 .— OR — Remove this card, then gain 3 .

You've found a Goblin weapon smithy making weapons for use against humans. With a tremendous yell you and your army descend upon their camp and drive them away. A search finds a magic card that never runs out of ore.

docs.title: Notas
docs.text:
• El segundo efecto se puede jugar desde la mano o desde el campo.Sin embargo, esto no agrega los dos efectos, y el artefacto se pone en la pila de descarte después de ser jugada.
  • Ver Efecto Permanente

docs.title: Piernas de Legión
docs.text:
Artefacto Menor

Reduce the Recruitment or Reinforcement cost of a unit by 4 - to a minimum of 0.— OR — Gain 2 .

Searching a ruin, you are amazed to find a piece of the Statue of Legion. You carefully dust it off before placing it into your pack.

docs.title: Ver También
docs.text:
• Arms of Legion
  • Cabeza de Legión
  • Escarcela de Legión

  • Torso de Legión

  • Lista de Artefactos

docs.title: Escudo de Coraje del León
docs.text:
Artefacto Reliquia

Descarta X cartas de tu mano para ganar +X .— O — Retira esta carta, después gana +3 .

🚧

docs.title: Escarcela de Legión
docs.text:
Artefacto Menor

Reduce the Recruitment or Reinforcement cost of a unit by 5 - to a minimum of 0.— OR — Gain 2 .

Registrando una ruina, te sorprende encontrar un trozo de la Estatua de la Legión. La desempolvas con cuidado antes de guardarla en tu mochila.

docs.text:
• Arms of Legion
  • Cabeza de Legión
  • Piernas de Legión

docs.title: Orbe Místico de Maná
docs.text:
Artefacto Mayor

Search(../4) your discard pile.— OR — Only if your discard pile is empty. Draw 2 cards.

You come upon a caravan of gypsies who are feasting and fortifying their bodies with mead. They call you forward and say, "If you prove that you can dance the Rama-Buta, we will reward you." You don't know it, but try anyway. They laugh hysterically, but admire your bravery, giving you a strange orb.

docs.title: Collar de Dientes de Dragón
docs.text:
Artefacto Mayor

+2 .— OR — During this Combat, you can cast 2 per Combat round.

🚧

docs.text:

  • Armadura de Escamas de Dragón

  • Lengua Ígnea del Dragón Rojo

docs.title: Garrote Ogro de la Ruina
docs.text:
Artefacto Mayor

Discard 1 card to gain +2 .— OR — +1

At a roadside tavern, a drunken Ogre challenges you to a fight. Not wanting to hurt the creature, you subdue him, instead. You take his massive club from him to prevent him from getting into any more trouble.

docs.title: Orbe de Inhibición
docs.text:
Artefacto Reliquia

During this Combat, all and Specialty cards deal 0 . Remove this card instead of discarding it.— OR — During this Combat round, units cannot use their special abilities.

You help a Peasant catch a mare. As gratitude, he hands you a sphere. When you grasp it, you feel the magical energy drain from your limbs...

docs.title: Orbe de Vulnerabilidad
docs.text:
Artefacto Reliquia

During this Combat, negate all units' special abilities related to .— OR — +2

You meet an old Wizard fiend of yours traveling in the opposite direction. He presents you with a gift: An orb that allows nearby magic resistant creatures to be harmed by magic.

docs.title: Medallón de la Negatividad
docs.text:
Artefacto Mayor

Ignore the effect of a spell from the School of Air Magic— OR — Ignore the effect of a spell from the School of Air Magic

🚧

docs.title: Medallón de la Segunda Visión
docs.text:
Artefacto Mayor

Selected unit cannot gain during this Combat.— OR — Remove 1 token.

You come upon a very old woman dying alone. You tend to her final needs and promise a proper burial. Grateful, she gives you a magic pendant emblazoned with a stylized eye. It lets you see with your eyes closed.

docs.title: Capa de las Retractaciones
docs.text:
Artefacto Mayor

During this Combat, no Héroe can use spells with Power "0".— OR — During this Combat, no Héroe can use Spells. Remove this card after Combat.

You discover a young woman fleeing from a hungry bear. You slay the beast in the nick of time, and the grateful Sorceress weaves a magic cloak from the bear's hide.

docs.title: Lengua Ígnea del Dragón Rojo
docs.text:
Artefacto Menor

+1 — OR — +1

As you are walking along a narrow path, a nearby bush suddenly bursts into flames. Before your very eyes, the flames become the image of a beautiful woman. She holds out a magnificent sword to you.

docs.title: Ver También
docs.text:
• Crown of Dragontooth
  • Armadura de Escamas de Dragón
  • Escudo de Escamas de Dragón
  • Tabardo de Ala de Dragón

  • Collar de Dientes de Dragón

docs.title: Tórax
docs.text:
Artefacto Menor

Select 1 Spell card from you discard pile and put it back into your hand. Then, shuffle your discard pile back into your deck of Might and Magic.— OR — +1

You trip over, what was, the rib cage of a large creature. Upon further examination, you discover the rib cage to be a piece of armor.

docs.title: Ver También
docs.text:
• Hoja Quebrada del Caballero Muerto
  • Escudo del Muerto Bostezante

  • Skull Helmet

  • Lista de Artefactos

docs.title: Anillo del Caminante
docs.text:
Artefacto Menor

For this Combat, your selected unit gains +1 .— OR — At start of Combat with Neutral Units put token on any unit except .

Visiting a local wise man, you explain the intent of your journey. He reaches into a sack and withdraws a strange ring which he hands to you.

docs.title: Sandalias del Santo
docs.text:
Artefacto Reliquia

Discard X cards from hand to gain +X .— OR — Remove this card, then gain +3 .

🚧

docs.title: Escamas del Basilisco Mayor
docs.text:
Artefacto Menor

+3 — OR — +1 , then draw a card.

You meet an old Armero, who claims he owes you a favor. Taking him up on it, he pieces together some Basilisk scales, forming a well-fashioned breastplate.

docs.title: Escudo del Centinela
docs.text:
Artefacto Reliquia

Discard 1 card to gain +3 .— OR — +2

You find a large box that seems to be made from some unknown material. When you touch it, the box opens with a load hiss, revealing a gleaming shield within.

docs.title: Grilletes de Guerra
docs.text:
Artefacto Mayor

If played at the start of Combat, the Enemy Héroe can neither Retreat nor Surrender.— OR — Draw 2 cards, choose 1 card and discard the other.

Walking through the ruins of an ancient walled city, you find the instrument of the city's destruction, the elaborately crafted Grilletes de Guerra.

docs.title: Escudo de los Condenados
docs.text:
Artefacto Mayor

Target unit gains +3 and suffers 1 . It cannot be used on an enemy unit.— OR — Target unit gains +5 and suffers 2 . It cannot be used on an enemy unit.

A Sprite is carrying a Shield as big as it is. Yuu ask, "Need help?" The Sprite glares at you and answers, "You think this is funny? Fine. You can carry it. I much prefer flying anyway."

docs.title: Escudo de los Señores Enanos
docs.text:
Artefacto Menor

Use this after the Attack die roll. Ignore the Attack die and any additional effects it triggered.— OR — +1

While searching through the rubble of a collapsed mine, you free a group of trapped Dwarves. Grateful, the leader ives you a finely crafted shield.

docs.title: Escudo del Muerto Bostezante
docs.text:
Artefacto Menor

Discard 1 card to gain +2 .— OR — +1

Your units discover an eerie shrine dedicated to the Undead. You bless the shrine, causing the stone shield emblem, above the altar, to crack. Beneath it, is a real shield, which you decide to remove from this unholy place.

docs.title: Ver También
docs.text:
• Hoja Quebrada del Caballero Muerto
  • Tórax

  • Skull Helmet

  • Lista de Artefactos

docs.title: Ver También
docs.text:
• Hoja Quebrada del Caballero Muerto
  • Tórax

  • Escudo del Muerto Bostezante

  • Lista de Artefactos

docs.title: Espéculo
docs.text:
Artefacto Menor

Discover any Map tile adjacent to the Map tile your Héroe is currently on..— OR — Remove this card, then draw 1 card.

A merchant from far away lands, trades you a new invention of his people for traveling supplies. It makes distant objects appear closer, and he calls it, a Espéculo.

docs.title: Sombrero del Encantador
docs.text:
Artefacto Reliquia

Remove 1 card from your hand, then Search(2) the card's deck.— OR — Remove this card and another one from your hand or discard pile.

You see a Wizard fleeing from a Dragon. He opens a portal and rides through, getting his bat knocked off by the edge of the gate. The Dragon follows, and the gate closes, You pick the hat up.

docs.title: Notas
docs.text:
• With the first effect, only abilities, artifacts, and spells can be exchanged, as only those have a corresponding deck to draw from. Statistics and specialties can not be removed.
  • 1 Con el segundo efecto, cualquier carta puede eliminarse junto con el Sombrero del Encantador.

docs.title: Ver También
docs.text:
• Lista de Artefactos

  1. Not officially confirmed by game designers, and is therefore considered a Community rule. ↩

docs.title: Espíritu de Opresión
docs.text:
Artefacto Menor

During this Combat, neither player can use the token or reroll Attack dice.— OR — +1

Walking through the ruins of an ancient walled city, you find the instrument of the city's destruction, the Espíritu de Opresión.

docs.title: Hombreras de Contrapeso
docs.text:
Artefacto Mayor

Play this card immediately after an enemy casts a . If it was cast with 1 or less, ignore the effect.— OR — Remove this card, then Search(1) .

The Necromancer blasts the Paladin with a fire bolt, bringing him to his knees. You slay the evil one before the final blow. The grateful Paladin gives you the cloak that saved him.

docs.title: Espada del fuego infernal
docs.text:
Artefacto Mayor

+3 . This unit suffers 1 . This effect cannot be used on an enemy unit.— OR — +4 . This unit suffers 2 . This effect cannot be used on an enemy unit.

During a sudden storm, a bolt of lightning strikes a tree, splitting it. Inside the tree you find a mysterious sword.

docs.title: Espada del Juicio
docs.text:
Artefacto Reliquia

Discard X cards from hand to gain +X .— OR — Discard X cards from hand to gain +X .

A Paladin has been mortally wounded by a group of Zombies. He asks you to take his sword and finish what he started. As you pick it up, everything becomes a blur. The Zombies lie dead.

docs.title: Targa del Ogro Enloquecido
docs.text:
Artefacto Mayor

Discard 2 cards to gain +2 . Then, instead of discarding, put this card back into your hand.— OR — +1

You come upon a bridge spanning a dry gully. As you begin to cross, a gigantic, maddened Ogre appears from the other side and charges toward you, forcing you to slay it. You decide to take its shield, as a trophy.

docs.title: Coraza del Titán
docs.text:
Artefacto Reliquia

Discard 1 card to gain +4 .— OR — +2 .

A Titan stops you and says, "Pay me 5,000 Gold, or I shall slay you where you stand." You refuse. The Titan grabs the sword hanging from his belt, but you duck between his legs. He is so surprised by this maneuver that he trips, falling on his sword and killing himself, instantly. You relieve him of his belongings.

docs.title: Gladius del Titán
docs.text:
Artefacto Reliquia

Discard 1 card to gain +3 .— OR — +2

A Titan stops you and says, "Pay me 5,000 Gold, or I shall slay you where you stand." You refuse. The Titan grabs the sword hanging from his belt, but you duck between his legs. He is so surprised by this maneuver that he trips, falling on his sword and killing himself, instantly.

docs.title: Torso de Legión
docs.text:
Artefacto Menor

Reduce the cost of Recruitment or reduce the cost of Reinforcing a unit by 6 (to a minimum of 0).— OR — Gain 1 or 2 .

Registrando una ruina, te sorprende encontrar un trozo de la Estatua de la Legión. La desempolvas con cuidado antes de guardarla en tu mochila.

docs.title: Ver También
docs.text:
• Arms of Legion
  • Cabeza de Legión
  • Piernas de Legión

  • Escarcela de Legión

  • Lista de Artefactos

docs.title: Túnica del Rey Cíclope
docs.text:
Artefacto Mayor

Draw 1 card and gain +1 .— OR — +2

You catch a Cyclops skinny dipping, and as a prank you make off with his clothes. Later, you realize the tunic is magical.

docs.title: Vial de Sangre Vital
docs.text:
Artefacto Mayor

Remove up to 3 from one of your units.— OR — For this Combat, your selected unit gains +1 .

You find a mystical shrine hidden among the trees. Floating above the altar is a vial said to contain the Blood of Life. You very carefully remove it, taking care not to disturb anything else.

docs.title: Carro de Munición
docs.text:
Proclama de los Astrólogos

Hasta la siguiente ronda de Astrólogos, cada Ballesta realiza +1 , cada Tienda de Primeros Auxilios cura +1 ‍, y cada Carro de Munición permite repetir 1 Dado de Ataque para todas las unidades a distancia.

Carro de Munición - ¡la mejor máquina!¡Yo!¡Solo yo tengo el poder del infinito!¿Por qué no hay un héroe que se especialice en mi?¡Porque yo mismo debería ser un héroe! ¡Weehee!

docs.title: Notas
docs.text: • Si se usa el efecto experto de Artillería durante esta semana, inflingirá 3 veces 2 de daño, es decir, 6 de daño en total.

docs.title: Ver También
docs.text:
• Lista de Cartas de los Astrólogos
  • Lista de Máquinas de Guerra

docs.title: Lagarto Molesto
docs.text:
Proclama de los Astrólogos

Cada jugador debe barajar todas sus cartas de Artefacto y Hechizo de su mano junto con su mazo y robar el mismo número de cartas de la parte superior de su mazo de Poder y Magia.

¡Eh, Héroe! ¡Héroe! ¡Eh, ¡Héroe! ¡Héroe! ¡Eh!

docs.title: Ver También
docs.text:
• Lista de Artefactos
  • Lista de Cartas de los Astrólogos
  • Lista de Hechizos

docs.title: Semental del Batallón
docs.text:
Proclama de los Astrólogos

Hasta la siguiente ronda de Astrólogos:Cada Héroe gana +1 Movimiento.

"¡Yo, Adrienne, lo hice!"

docs.title: Gran Limpieza
docs.text:
Proclama de los Astrólogos

Cada jugador debe inmediatamente descartar todas las cartas de su mano y robar el mismo número de cartas.

- ¡Es hora de la limpieza de primavera!- Es invierno. Estamos en Eeofol... Claro...

docs.title: Cielo Azul
docs.text:
Proclama de los Astrólogos

Hasta la siguiente ronda de Astrólogos, todos los de las Escuelas Magia Aérea y Magia Acuática son lanzados con +1 .

Hola Caras de ElementalBienvenidos a las Carreras de EnrothUna celebración, El Cielo Azul nos espera ahí arribaY ahora es el día que nosotros esperábamos

docs.title: Ver También
docs.text:
• Lista de Cartas de los Astrólogos
  • Lista de Hechizos

docs.title: Charlie y su Circo
docs.text:
Proclama de los Astrólogos

Al principio de esta ronda y de la siguiente, cada jugador puede robar hasta 3 cartas de cualquier mazo de Unidades Neutrales y Reclutar una de ellas. Los Jugadores aún deben el coste de reclutamiento y tener la Vivienda correspondiente en su Ciudad. Baraja después las cartas restantes en su mazo correspondiente.

¡Hola, Héroe! ¿No quieres un globo? Yo, Héroe, soy Charlie, el Payaso Bailarín. Hay orcos, trolls y todo tipo de sorpresas aquí abajo. Y globos también, ¡de todos los colores!

docs.title: Notas
docs.text:
• Las unidades no pueden ser reclutadas a través de esta carta.
  • 1 Cuando se juega con miniaturas (ej. cuando se juega en el gran campo de batalla), esta habilidad no puede utilizarse para reclutar unidades de una facción controlada por otro jugador, ni para reclutar unidades neutrales que ya estén reclutadas por otro jugador. Si un jugador roba una carta de este tipo, que no puede ser reclutada, deberá robar una carta de reemplazo en su lugar.

docs.title: El Mago Loco
docs.text:
Proclama de los Astrólogos

Hasta la siguiente ronda de Astrólogos:La primera carta de Hechizo jugada por cada jugador vuelve a su mano, en vez de ser descartada.

"¡Soy un duendecillo volador! ¡Vuela! Vuela""Disculpe, Sr. Mago, ¿puede ayudarnos? Necesitamos ir a AvLee...""Lo siento, niña, ya no hago esas cosas. ¿Qué tal un abrazo? ¡Esa es la mejor clase de magia que existe!"

docs.title: Gnomo Bailarín
docs.text:
Proclama de los Astrólogos

Cada jugador puede Retirar una carta de Característica de su pila de descartes o de su mano para ganar 1 carta de Característica Potenciada del mismo tipo.

Bienvenido al agujero del infierno, se pone peor aquí cada día.Aprende a vivir como una bestia de fuego en el pozo donde jugamos.

docs.title: Silencio Sepulcral
docs.text:
Proclama de los Astrólogos

Nada cambia.

Hola silencio, mi viejo amigo.He venido a charlar contigo de nuevo.

docs.title: Exploradores
docs.text:
Proclama de los Astrólogos

Durante esta ronda, los jugadores no roban cartas al comienzo de sus turnos. En su lugar, cada jugador roba cartas de su . Después, cada uno de ellos puede descartarse de cualquier número de cartas. Por cada 3 cartas descartadas de esta manera, pueden Retirar una carta Característica y reemplazarla por una carta Característica Potenciada del mismo tipo.

"Somos exploradores. Los que se adentran en las regiones desconocidas de la experiencia. Demonios para unos, ángeles para otros."

docs.title: Notas
docs.text: • 1 La Característica eliminada debe proceder de la mano del jugador. Al coger la [Característica] Potenciada(../statistics/index.md), el jugador la añade a su mano.

docs.title: Duendecillo Elegante
docs.text:
Proclama de los Astrólogos

Cada jugador inmediatamente gana 1

Decidí tomar, en mis propias manos, el destino.Esta fue la primera vez para el amor, que hice.Éramos jóvenes, yo era el dueño del momento.Salimos en una cita a Skeleton Transformer.Su corazón está en mi manga, nos conocemos, a fondo.He mirado a través de ella, conozco cada hueso de ella.

docs.title: Conejo Peludo
docs.text:
Proclama de los Astrólogos

Cada jugador tira inmediatamente 1 dado de Tesoro y gana la bonificación obtenida.

Deprisa, deprisa, consigue tus tesoros gratis, ¡cada tesoro es un voto para Conejo Peludo!

docs.title: Cuarenta Ladrones
docs.text:
Proclama de los Astrólogos

Hasta la siguiente ronda de Astrólogos, siempre que un jugador esté a punto de robar una carta de Evento, roba 2 cartas en lugar de 1, elige 1 para resolver, y pone la otra en el fondo del mazo de Evento.

Mientras camino por las tierras de la sombra de la muerteMiro atrás a mis hechos y me doy cuenta de que no queda muchoSerá mejor que tengas cuidado con lo que dices y por donde caminas.O tú y tu ejército podríais quedar cubiertos con la saliva del Dragón Cobrizo.

docs.title: Notas
docs.text: • En un juego sin eventos esta carta se elimina y en su lugar se roba otra carta.

docs.title: Castor Amistoso
docs.text:
Proclama de los Astrólogos

Si robas esta carta en la primera ronda de Astrólogos, descártala y roba otra carta.Elimina inmediatamente todos los cubos negros de todas las ubicaciones del mapa.

"Cuando la Espada de Escarcha toque la Hoja de Armagedón, el tiempo de Enroth dejará de existir entonces.""¿Sabes que en realidad no rima?"

docs.title: Notas
docs.text:
• Sólo se eliminan los cubos negros, los cubos de facción de color permanecen en los campos (ej. minas).
  • Una segunda ficha de grial no puede entrar en juego con esta carta, aunque el campo con el grial volviera a ser visitable.

docs.title: Dragón Dorado
docs.text:
Proclama de los Astrólogos

Al comienzo de la próxima ronda de Recursos, todos los jugadores ganan 5 .

Oro, oro, oro, da vida a tu amor.Oro, oro, oro, da vida a tu esperanza.Oro, oro, oro, da vida a tu sueño.Oro, oro, oro, da vida a tu alma.

docs.title: Dragón Codicioso
docs.text:
Proclama de los Astrólogos

Al comienzo de la siguiente ronda de Recursos, todos los jugadores ganan 1 menos, hasta un mínimo de 0.

Nunca te rías de dragones vivos, ¡Dracon, eres tonto!

docs.title: Brujo Sombrío
docs.text:
Proclama de los Astrólogos

Hasta la siguiente ronda de Astrólogos:La primera carta de Hechizo jugada en el turno de cada jugador obtiene +1 .

¡Contra el poder de Eeofol, no puede haber victoria!

docs.title: Sátiro Genial
docs.text:
Proclama de los Astrólogos

Hasta la siguiente ronda de Astrólogos:Siempre que desencadenes un Combate con cualesquiera Unidades Neutrales, puedes elegir una carta de Unidades Neutrales para descartarla y robar otra carta del mismo nivel en su lugar.

"¿Conoces alguna melodía de AvLee?""Lo siento, no.""Bien, eso es bueno porque probablemente esto no suene a ninguna."

docs.title: Héroe
docs.text:
Proclama de los Astrólogos

Cada jugador puede 4 para Retirar una carta Característica de su mano y sustituirla por una carta Característica Potenciada del mismo tipo. Cada jugador puede hacerlo dos veces, pero ambos intercambios deben hacerse en el mismo turno. Una vez que un jugador hace el intercambio, coloca su cubo de facción sobre esta carta para marcar el hecho.

"¡Eres, sin duda, el peor Héroe del que he oído hablar!""Pero has oído hablar de mí".

docs.title: Amigos de Isra
docs.text:
Proclama de los Astrólogos

Each player can immediately Reinforce a unit on the "Pocos" side at half the cost.

I was all alone, once upon a time.With me, I only had a knife.But now, I have friends.Now, I have friends for live.

docs.title: Tortuga Mágica
docs.text:
Proclama de los Astrólogos

Until the next Astrologer's round:Each Héroe suffers -1 Movement.

Men live and die, and the Tortoise Moves. Empires grow and crumble, and the Tortoise Moves. Gods come and go, and still the Tortoise Moves. The Tortoise Moves.

docs.text:

At the beginning of the next round, each player can take 1 Máquina de Guerra of their choice from the Máquina de Guerras deck at not cost.

Hi, this is McGiver. We all know how the Máquina de Guerras work, so when you hear the vrrrum, go for it.

docs.text: • The war machine will be chosen and taken in the resource round that follows the current astrologers proclaim round.

docs.text:

At the beginning of the next Resource round, all players gain 1 .

"I wasn't aware that leprechaun gold vanishes." "How could it be else when you just have taken it from me...?"

docs.title: Plano Entre Planos
docs.text:
Proclama de los Astrólogos

Each player can immediately Remove up to 2 cards from their hand or from their discard pile.

Hello? Is anybody right there?

docs.title: Crecimiento Profundo
docs.text:
Proclama de los Astrólogos

Until the next Astrologers' round:Your hand limit is increased by 1.

A horn of plenty spills from your hands into the starved lives of hundreds...

docs.title: Tierra Quemada
docs.text:
Proclama de los Astrólogos

Until the next Astrologers round, all from the Earth Magic and Fire Magic Schools are cast at a +1 .

And I miss you, like the scorched earth miss the rain.

Each player gains .

Some Kreegan has told me: "Hell is other people."

docs.title: Comadreja Veloz
docs.text:
Proclama de los Astrólogos

Until the next Astrologer's round:Once per turn, each player can reroll a Tesoro die or a Resource die.

You need cool rants for the victory dance.Baboons are never better than weasels.Your opponent reigns king in their mind.They dream to be great as the weasely kind.I am the Swift Weasel!

All players flip one of their units from the "Pack" to the "Pocos" side, if possible.

All populations are halved.Snap.

Each player can immediately search the Unidades Neutrales deck and Recruit 1 chosen unit associated with their faction for free. Each player still needs to have the corresponding dwelling built in their town.

"My Lord, my Lady! We're at your command!"

"Where do you go, fantastic dream bird?""Eeofol, Deyja, Place Between Planes... Still interested?"

At the beginning of the next Resource round, all players gain 5 less .

Sit down, there's a party in the tavern today!We are thirsty again!La la la!We drink for a week of Wild DebaucheryFor seven days now!La la la!

docs.title: Una Subasta Turbia
docs.text:
Evento

Repite 3 veces: Revela la carta superior del mazo de Artefacto. En secreto, cada jugador toma tanto en su mano como esté dispuesto a pagar por él. A continuación, revela tus apuestas al mismo tiempo. El que tenga la propuesta más alta descarta el y reclama la carta. Si no hay apuestas o hay un empate, descarte la carta.

En la profundidad de la noche, te encuentras con un campamento abarrotado que rodea un escenario. En él, un hombre corpulento con un bigote retorcido grita vigorosamente, "...y el jarrón va a la hermosa ¡Dama barbuda en la última fila! ¡Ahora contempla este maravilloso objeto por el que derramé lágrimas y sangre! No la mía, por supuesto... El precio de salida es..."

docs.title: Comerciante de Artefactos
docs.text:
Evento

Roba 5 artifactoss. Puedes comprar cualesquiera de ellos o el que esté descubierto en la pila de descarte de Artefacto. Al terminar, entrega el resto de cartas al jugador de la izquierda. El intercambio continuará hasta que la última carta sea comprada o hasta que las cartas lleguen al jugador que las robó. cartas de Artefacto Menor cuestan 3 , Mayor 5 , Reliquia 7 .

En tu viaje, deambulas por el taller de un herrero. Te dan la bienvenida con una alegre sonrisa y presentan sus productos.

docs.title: Cripta
docs.text:
Evento

Cada jugador elige una opción: Gana Moral Negativa. Luego lanza 2 . Si alguno de ellos muestra #, no ganas nada. En caso contrario, resuelve un resultado— O —Gana Moral Positiva.— O —Solo para . Refuerza una de tus o por la mitad del coste.

Te acercas tímidamente a la cripta funeraria de antiguos guerreros. Perturbar la paz de los muertos es un acto sucio y despreciable. Sin embargo, algo de valor puede estar enterrado entre estas antiguas tumbas...

docs.title: Pantano Maldito
docs.text:
Evento

Cada jugador elige una opción: Gana Moral Negativa. Luego tira 2 y elige un resultado.— O —Retira uno o más de tu mano; si retiras al menos 2, Busca (3) del mazo de Artefacto.— O —Descarta tu unidad más barata.— O —Solo para . Refuerza una de tus o gratis.

En tu viaje, te adentras en un pantano. Sólo al cabo de un rato te das cuenta de la inquietante atmósfera que rodea este lugar y de los ojos que acechan bajo la superficie del agua. Los ojos de los muertos. Tu ejército tiembla de pánico mientras tú reflexionas. ¿Los obligarás a seguir adelante o los protegerás con tu magia?

docs.title: Guarida de Ladrones
docs.text:
Evento

Coge las 2 cartas superiores de un mazo de Unidad Neutral de tu elección. Puedes comprar una de ellas. Luego decide qué hacer con la(s) carta(s) restante(s) - puedes colocarlas en la parte inferior o superior del correspondiente mazo de Unidad Neutral.

Buscando entre la maleza, encuentras la entrada secreta a la Guarida de los Ladrones. Allí dentro, una vieja "conocida" te agarra del brazo y empieza a hablarte de todos los "secretos" que ha aprendido desde vuestro último encuentro.

docs.title: Jardín de Apocalipsis
docs.text:
Evento

Cada jugador elige una opción: Robar 4 cartas de tu pila de descartes o de tu mazo. Luego Retira cualquier número de cartas de Hechizo o Habilidad de tu mano. Por cada dos cartas eliminadas de esta forma, puedes realizar Buscar(2) en el mazo de Hechizo o el mazo de Habilidad. Después, descarta todas las cartas de la mano y roba hasta tu .— O —Déjalas y no ganes nada.

Junto al camino ves un hermoso jardín lleno de flores en plena floración. Un monje sentado en el centro te invita a meditar con él.
